Molten Giant
data.description: Costs (1) less for each damage your hero has taken.
data.flavorText: He gets terrible heartburn.  BECAUSE HE IS FULL OF LAVA.

data.name: Mountain Giant
data.description: Costs (1) less for each other card in your hand.
data.flavorText: His mother said that he was just big boned.

data.name: Anyfin Can Happen
data.description: Summon 7 Murlocs that died this game.
data.flavorText: Theme song by Ellie Goldfin and Blagghghlrlrl Harris.

data.name: DOOM!
data.description: Destroy all minions. Draw a card for each.
data.flavorText: We ran out of space for "DOOOOOOOOOOOM!!!!!"

data.name: Mind Control
data.description: Take control of an enemy minion.
data.flavorText: Nominated as "Spell Most Likely to Make Your Opponent Punch the Wall."

data.name: Pyroblast
data.description: Deal 10 damage.
data.flavorText: Take the time for an evil laugh after you draw this card.

data.name: C'Thun
data.description: Battlecry: Deal damage equal to this minion's Attack randomly split among all enemies.
data.flavorText: C'Thun's least favorite Hearthstone card: Eye for an Eye.

data.name: Deathwing
data.description: Battlecry: Destroy all other minions and discard your hand.
data.flavorText: Once a noble dragon known as Neltharion, Deathwing lost his mind and shattered Azeroth before finally being defeated.  Daddy issues?

data.name: Deathwing, Dragonlord
data.description: Deathrattle: Put all Dragons from your hand into the battlefield.
data.flavorText: To his credit, Deathwing really took to heart the feedback he was receiving that he needed to be "more of a team player".

data.name: Faceless Behemoth
data.flavorText: Rejected names: Forty-Foot Faceless, Big ol' No-face, Huge Creature Sans Face, Teddy.

data.name: Frost Giant
data.description: Costs (1) less for each time you used your Hero Power this game.
data.flavorText: Don't ask him about the beard.  JUST DON'T.

data.name: N'Zoth, the Corruptor
data.description: Battlecry: Summon your Deathrattle minions that died this game.
data.flavorText: Has not been able to get "Under the Sea" out of his head for like FIVE THOUSAND YEARS.

data.name: Sea Giant
data.description: Costs (1) less for each other minion on the battlefield.
data.flavorText: See?  Giant.

data.name: Varian Wrynn
data.description: Battlecry: Draw 3 cards.Put any minions you drew directly into the battlefield.
data.flavorText: Leader of the Alliance!  Father of Anduin!  Also he likes to play Arena, and he averages 12 wins.

data.name: Yogg-Saron, Hope's End
data.description: Battlecry: Cast a random spell for each spell you've cast this game (targets chosen randomly).
data.flavorText: I spell your doom... Y-O-U-R D-O-O-M!

data.name: Y'Shaarj, Rage Unbound
data.description: At the end of your turn, put a minion from your deck into the battlefield.
data.flavorText: When he's working out, he binds all that rage back into a ponytail.

data.name: Alexstrasza
data.description: Battlecry: Set a hero's remaining Health to 15.
data.flavorText: Alexstrasza the Life-Binder brings life and hope to everyone.  Except Deathwing.  And Malygos.  And Nekros.

data.name: Anub'arak
data.description: Deathrattle: Return this to your hand and summon a 4/4 Nerubian.
data.flavorText: Was actually a pretty nice guy before, you know, the whole Lich King thing.

data.name: Arch-Thief Rafaam
data.description: Battlecry: Discover a powerful Artifact.
data.flavorText: He's very good at retrieving artifacts.  From other people's museums.

data.name: Aviana
data.description: Your minions cost (1).
data.flavorText: Call her "Tweety".  She'll find it real funny.  I PROMISE.

data.name: Blade of C'Thun
data.description: Battlecry: Destroy a minion. Add its Attack and Health to_your C'Thun's (wherever it is).
data.flavorText: C'Thun demands a sacrifice! Preferably a Deathwing.

data.name: Blood of The Ancient One
data.description: If you control two of theseat the end of your turn, merge them into 'The Ancient One'.
data.flavorText: Add two cups of Blood of the Ancient One to one cup of lemon juice. Add just a dash of sugar and stir. Delicious!

data.name: Cenarius
data.description: Choose One - Give your other minions +2/+2; or Summon two 2/2 Treants with Taunt.
data.flavorText: Yes, he's a demigod. No, he doesn't need to wear a shirt.

data.name: Icehowl
data.description: ChargeCan't attack heroes.
data.flavorText: This massive yeti just closes his eyes and charges at the nearest target.  The nearest Target is a couple blocks away and has sick deals on skateboards.

data.name: King Krush
data.description: Charge
data.flavorText: The best defense against King Krush is to have someone you don’t like standing in front of you.

data.name: Lord Jaraxxus
data.description: Battlecry: Destroy your hero and replace it with Lord Jaraxxus.
data.flavorText: "TRIFLING GNOME! YOUR ARROGANCE WILL BE YOUR UNDOING!!!!"

data.name: Majordomo Executus
data.description: Deathrattle: Replace your hero with Ragnaros, the Firelord.
data.flavorText: You thought Executus turned you into Ragnaros, but really Ragnaros was in you the whole time.

data.name: Malygos
data.description: Spell Damage +5
data.flavorText: Malygos hates it when mortals use magic.  He gets so mad!

data.name: Nefarian
data.description: Battlecry: Add 2 random spells to your hand (from your opponent's class).
data.flavorText: They call him "Blackwing" because he's a black dragon...... and he's got wings.

data.name: North Sea Kraken
data.description: Battlecry: Deal 4 damage.
data.flavorText: You have no idea how tired this guy is of being released.

data.name: Nozdormu
data.description: Players only have 15 seconds to take their turns.
data.flavorText: Time to write some flavor text.

data.name: Onyxia
data.description: Battlecry: Summon 1/1 Whelps until your side of the battlefield is full.
data.flavorText: Onyxia long manipulated the Stormwind Court by disguising herself as Lady Katrana Prestor.   You would have thought that the giant wings and scales would have been a giveaway.

data.name: Soggoth the Slitherer
data.description: TauntCan't be targeted by spells or Hero Powers.
data.flavorText: Don't tell Soggoth, but in the future he gets totally owned by the Master's Glaive and his skull becomes a tourist attraction.

data.name: Volcanic Lumberer
data.description: TauntCosts (1) less for each minion that died this turn.
data.flavorText: The roots, the roots, the roots is on fire!

data.name: Ysera
data.description: At the end of your turn, add a Dream Card to your hand.
data.flavorText: Ysera rules the Emerald Dream.  Which is some kind of green-mirror-version of the real world, or something?

data.name: Call of the Wild
data.description: Summon all three Animal Companions.
data.flavorText: "Hello. Misha, Leokk and Huffer aren't here right now, but if you leave a message we'll get back to you right away." BEEP.

data.name: Lay on Hands
data.description: Restore #8 Health. Draw 3 cards.
data.flavorText: A grammatically awkward life saver.

data.name: Twisting Nether
data.description: Destroy all minions.
data.flavorText: The Twisting Nether is a formless place of magic and illusion and destroyed minions.

data.name: Al'Akir the Windlord
data.description: Windfury, Charge, Divine Shield, Taunt
data.flavorText: He is the weakest of the four Elemental Lords.  And the other three don't let him forget it.

data.name: Anomalus
data.description: Deathrattle: Deal 8 damage to all minions.
data.flavorText: That's short for "Anomnomnomnomalus".

data.name: Chromaggus
data.description: Whenever you draw a card, put another copy into your hand.
data.flavorText: Left head and right head can never agree about what to eat for dinner, so they always end up just eating ramen again.

data.name: Doomcaller
data.description: Battlecry: Give your C'Thun +2/+2 (wherever it is). If it's dead, shuffle it into your deck.
data.flavorText: "Hello, is Doom there? No? Can I leave a message?"

data.name: Eldritch Horror
data.flavorText: Often wonders what path his life might have taken if he wasn't named, you know, "Eldritch Horror".

data.name: Fossilized Devilsaur
data.description: Battlecry: If you control a Beast, gain Taunt.
data.flavorText: This was the only job he could get after the dinosaur theme park debacle.

data.name: Giant Sand Worm
data.description: Whenever this attacks and kills a minion, it may attack again.
data.flavorText: Banned from every all-you-can-eat buffet on Azeroth.

data.name: Grommash Hellscream
data.description: ChargeEnrage: +6 Attack
data.flavorText: Grommash drank the tainted blood of Mannoroth, dooming the orcs to green skin and red eyes!  Maybe not his best decision.

data.name: Gruul
data.description: At the end of each turn, gain +1/+1 .
data.flavorText: He's Gruul "the Dragonkiller".  He just wanted to cuddle them… he never meant to…

data.name: Ironbark Protector
data.description: Taunt
data.flavorText: I dare you to attack Darnassus.

data.name: Ragnaros the Firelord
data.description: Can't attack. At the end of your turn, deal 8 damage to a random enemy.
data.flavorText: Ragnaros was summoned by the Dark Iron dwarves, who were eventually enslaved by the Firelord.  Summoning Ragnaros often doesn’t work out the way you want it to.

data.name: Ragnaros, Lightlord
data.description: At the end of your turn, restore 8 Health to a damaged friendly character.
data.flavorText: What happens when you try and corrupt a corrupted firelord? DOUBLE NEGATIVE, INSECT!

data.name: Rhonin
data.description: Deathrattle: Add 3 copies of Arcane Missiles to your hand.
data.flavorText: A masterless shamurai.

data.name: The Boogeymonster
data.description: Whenever this attacks and kills a minion, gain +2/+2.
data.flavorText: Has 20 years of training in classical ballet, but ALLLLLL he ever gets asked to do is boogie.

data.name: Tirion Fordring
data.description: Divine Shield. Taunt. Deathrattle: Equip a 5/3 Ashbringer.
data.flavorText: If you haven't heard the Tirion Fordring theme song, it's because it doesn't exist.

data.name: Gladiator's Longbow
data.description: Your hero is Immune while attacking.
data.flavorText: The longbow allows shots to be fired from farther away and is useful for firing on particularly odorous targets.

data.name: Gorehowl
data.description: Attacking a minion costs 1 Attack instead of 1 Durability.
data.flavorText: Grommash Hellscream's famous axe.  Somehow this ended up in Prince Malchezaar's possession.  Quite the mystery!

data.name: Everyfin is Awesome
data.description: Give your minions +2/+2.Costs (1) less for each Murloc you control.
data.flavorText: Everyfin is cool when you're part of a murloc team!

data.name: Flamestrike
data.description: Deal 4 damage to all enemy minions.
data.flavorText: When the ground is on fire, you should not stop, drop, and roll.

data.name: Sprint
data.description: Draw 4 cards.
data.flavorText: Rogues are not good joggers.

data.name: Wisps of the Old Gods
data.description: Choose One - Summon seven 1/1 Wisps; or Give your minions +2/+2.
data.flavorText: They're just normal wisps, actually. The "Of the Old Gods" bit is just marketing.

data.name: Acidmaw
data.description: Whenever another minion takes damage, destroy it.
data.flavorText: With the help of his trusty sidekick Dreadscale, the giant jormungar Acidmaw is ready to face any knight!

data.name: Ancient of Lore
data.description: Choose One - Draw a card; or Restore 5 Health.
data.flavorText: Go ahead, carve your initials in him.

data.name: Ancient of War
data.description: Choose One -+5 Attack; or +5 Health and Taunt.
data.flavorText: Young Night Elves love to play "Who can get the Ancient of War to Uproot?"  You lose if you get crushed to death.

data.name: Ancient Shieldbearer
data.description: Battlecry: If your C'Thun has at least 10 Attack, gain 10 Armor.
data.flavorText: Back in her day, each shield weighed two tons and she had to carry four of them on each arm!

data.name: Archmage Antonidas
data.description: Whenever you cast a spell, add a 'Fireball' spell to your hand.
data.flavorText: Antonidas was the Grand Magus of the Kirin Tor, and Jaina's mentor.  This was a big step up from being Grand Magus of Jelly Donuts.

data.name: Baron Geddon
data.description: At the end of your turn, deal 2 damage to ALL other characters.
data.flavorText: Baron Geddon was Ragnaros's foremost lieutenant, until he got FIRED.

data.name: Bog Creeper
data.description: Taunt
data.flavorText: He's tried other things, but bog sidling, bog ambling, and bog trundling just aren't as effective as bog creeping.

data.name: Captured Jormungar
data.flavorText: You can keep him, but you have to promise to feed him and clean out his tank every day!

data.name: Chillmaw
data.description: TauntDeathrattle: If you're holding a Dragon, deal 3 damage to all minions.
data.flavorText: Chillmaw keeps trying to ruin the Grand Tournament, and she would've done it too, if it weren't for those dang kids!

data.name: Cho'gall
data.description: Battlecry: The next spell you cast this turn costs Health instead of Mana.
data.flavorText: Even after all this time, Gul'dan still makes Cho'gall go get donuts and coffee.

data.name: Confessor Paletress
data.description: Inspire: Summon a random Legendary minion.
data.flavorText: She sees into your past and makes you face your fears.  Most common fear:  Getting Majordomo out of Sneed's Old Shredder.

data.name: Core Hound
data.flavorText: You don’t tame a Core Hound. You just train it to eat someone else before it eats you.

data.name: Eadric the Pure
data.description: Battlecry: Change all enemy minions'Attack to 1.
data.flavorText: Nobody rocks a monocle like Eadric.

data.name: Fearsome Doomguard
data.flavorText: They were originally called Cuddleguards, but they were not inspiring the proper amount of fear.

data.name: Grotesque Dragonhawk
data.description: Windfury
data.flavorText: They say that "grotesque is in the eye of the beholder," but that's just because they've never seen a Grotesque Dragonhawk. Yikes!

data.name: Guardian of Kings
data.description: Battlecry: Restore 6 Health to your hero.
data.flavorText: Holy beings from the beyond are so cliché!

data.name: Hogger, Doom of Elwynn
data.description: Whenever this minion takes damage, summon a 2/2 Gnoll with Taunt.
data.flavorText: When C'thun went to sleep, he checked under his bed for Hogger.

data.name: Knight of the Wild
data.description: Whenever you summon a Beast, reduce the Cost of this card by (1).
data.flavorText: He gets a discount on the tournament entry fee because he is his own horse.

data.name: Malkorok
data.description: Battlecry: Equip a random weapon.
data.flavorText: Garrosh's best buddy. It's true. Look it up.

data.name: Obsidian Destroyer
data.description: At the end of your turn, summon a 1/1 Scarab with Taunt.
data.flavorText: No obsidian is safe around the Obsidian Destroyer!

data.name: Prophet Velen
data.description: Double the damage and healing of your spells and Hero Power.
data.flavorText: He's been exiled from his home, and all his brothers turned evil, but otherwise he doesn't have a lot to complain about.

data.name: Ravenholdt Assassin
data.description: Stealth
data.flavorText: Just mail him a package with a name and 10,000 gold.  He'll take care of the rest.

data.name: Rend Blackhand
data.description: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, destroy a Legendary minion.
data.flavorText: Rend believes he is the True Warchief of the Horde and he keeps editing the wikipedia page for "Warchief of the Horde" to include his picture.

data.name: Skycap'n Kragg
data.description: CharrrrrgeCosts (1) less for each friendly Pirate.
data.flavorText: What's more boss than riding a parrot with a jawbone for a shoulderpad while wielding a giant hook-lance-thing and wearing a pirate hat?  NOTHING.

data.name: Stormwind Champion
data.description: Your other minions have +1/+1.
data.flavorText: When Deathwing assaulted the capital, this soldier was the only member of his squad to survive. Now he's all bitter and stuff.

data.name: Twin Emperor Vek'lor
data.description: [x]TauntBattlecry: If your C'Thun hasat least 10 Attack, summonanother Emperor.
data.flavorText: Do they make decisions based on age? "I'm two minutes older therefore we burn this village."

data.name: War Golem
data.flavorText: Golems are not afraid, but for some reason they still run when you cast Fear on them.  Instinct, maybe?  A desire to blend in?

data.name: Avenging Wrath
data.description: Deal 8 damage randomly split among all enemies.
data.flavorText: Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham!

data.name: Ball of Spiders
data.description: Summon three 1/1 Webspinners.
data.flavorText: "THEY'RE EVERYWHERE GET THEM OFF!!!" - Everyone

data.name: Blizzard
data.description: Deal 2 damage to all enemy minions and Freeze them.
data.flavorText: This spell can be very Entertaining.

data.name: Dark Bargain
data.description: Destroy 2 random enemy minions. Discard 2 random cards.
data.flavorText: A prime example of lose-lose negotiating.

data.name: Enter the Coliseum
data.description: Destroy all minions except each player's highest Attack minion.
data.flavorText: You have to get past the vendors first.  So many are lost to shopping...

data.name: Entomb
data.description: Choose an enemy minion.Shuffle it into your deck.
data.flavorText: It's perfectly safe as long as you remember to put in air holes.

data.name: Holy Fire
data.description: Deal 5 damage. Restore #5 Health to your hero.
data.flavorText: Often followed by Holy Smokes!

data.name: Siphon Soul
data.description: Destroy a minion. Restore #3 Health to your hero.
data.flavorText: You probably should avoid siphoning your own soul.  You might create some kind of weird infinite loop.

data.name: Starfire
data.description: Deal 5 damage.Draw a card.
data.flavorText: Balance is important to druids.  This card is perfectly balanced.

data.name: Thistle Tea
data.description: Draw a card. Add 2 extra copies of it to your hand.
data.flavorText: Aren't Thistles prickly?  Why would you drink them? I don't get Rogues.

data.name: Vanish
data.description: Return all minions to their owner's hand.

data.name: Ancient Harbinger
data.description: At the start of your turn, put a 10-Cost minion from your deck into your hand.
data.flavorText: "honey, can u run down to the store and pick up some 10 cost minions? thx"

data.name: Archmage
data.description: Spell Damage +1
data.flavorText: You earn the title of Archmage when you can destroy anyone who calls you on it.

data.name: Argent Commander
data.description: ChargeDivine Shield
data.flavorText: The Argent Dawn stands vigilant against the Scourge, as well as people who cut in line at coffee shops.

data.name: Bolf Ramshield
data.description: Whenever your hero takes damage, this minion takes it instead.
data.flavorText: Bolf keeps coming in 2nd at the Grand Tournament.  It might be his year this year, if Lebron doesn't enter.

data.name: Boulderfist Ogre
data.flavorText: "ME HAVE GOOD STATS FOR THE COST"

data.name: Cabal Shadow Priest
data.description: Battlecry: Take control of an enemy minion that has 2 or less Attack.
data.flavorText: You never know who may be secretly working for the Cabal....

data.name: Cairne Bloodhoof
data.description: Deathrattle: Summon a 4/5 Baine Bloodhoof.
data.flavorText: Cairne was killed by Garrosh, so... don't put this guy in a Warrior deck.  It's pretty insensitive.

data.name: Coldarra Drake
data.description: You can use your Hero Power any number of times.
data.flavorText: The Grand Tournament has a "No dragons allowed" policy, but it's rarely enforced.

data.name: Corrupted Seer
data.description: Battlecry: Deal 2 damage to all non-Murloc minions.
data.flavorText: For seers, it's very handy to have your crystal ball hanging right in front of your face.

data.name: Dark Arakkoa
data.description: [x]TauntBattlecry: Give your C'Thun+3/+3 (wherever it is).
data.flavorText: There's a whole gradient of Arakkoa! This one is on the darker side.

data.name: Drakonid Crusher
data.description: Battlecry: If your opponent has 15 or less Health, gain +3/+3.
data.flavorText: Drakonids were created to have all the bad parts of a dragon in the form of a humaniod. But, like, why?

data.name: Dread Infernal
data.description: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage to ALL other characters.
data.flavorText: "INFERNOOOOOOOOOO!" - Jaraxxus, Eredar Lord of the Burning Legion

data.name: Emperor Thaurissan
data.description: At the end of your turn, reduce the Cost of cards in your hand by (1).
data.flavorText: His second greatest regret is summoning an evil Firelord who enslaved his entire people.

data.name: Faceless Summoner
data.description: Battlecry: Summon a random 3-Cost minion.
data.flavorText: They never get the recognition they deserve.

data.name: Fire Elemental
data.description: Battlecry: Deal 3 damage.
data.flavorText: He can never take a bath. Ewww.

data.name: Frost Elemental
data.description: Battlecry: Freeze a character.
data.flavorText: When a Water elemental and an Ice elemental love each other VERY much...

data.name: Gadgetzan Auctioneer
data.description: Whenever you cast a spell, draw a card.
data.flavorText: He used to run the black market auction house, but there was just too much violence and he had to move.

data.name: Grand Crusader
data.description: Battlecry: Add a random Paladin card to your hand.
data.flavorText: A veteran of a number of crusades, she is a force for light and goodness.  Her latest crusade is against goblin telemarketers.

data.name: Herald Volazj
data.description: Battlecry: Summon a 1/1 copy of each of your other minions.
data.flavorText: His whole job is yelling "Yogg-Saron comin'!"

data.name: Hogger
data.description: At the end of your turn, summon a 2/2 Gnoll with Taunt.
data.flavorText: Hogger is super powerful. If you kill him, it's because he let you.

data.name: Illidan Stormrage
data.description: Whenever you play a card, summon a 2/1 Flame of Azzinoth.
data.flavorText: Illidan's brother, Malfurion, imprisoned him beneath Hyjal for 10,000 years.  Stormrages are not good at letting go of grudges.

data.name: Justicar Trueheart
data.description: Battlecry: Replace your starting Hero Power with a better one.
data.flavorText: It's like putting racing stripes and a giant spoiler on your hero power.

data.name: Kidnapper
data.description: Combo: Return a minion to its owner's hand.
data.flavorText: He just wants people to see his vacation photos.

data.name: Kodorider
data.description: Inspire: Summon a 3/5 War Kodo.
data.flavorText: Someone called her a Rhinorider, and she's NOT HAPPY.

data.name: Lord of the Arena
data.description: Taunt
data.flavorText: He used to be a 2100+ rated arena player, but that was years ago and nobody can get him to shut up about it.

data.name: Master Jouster
data.description: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, gain Taunt and Divine Shield.
data.flavorText: Needs just a few more ratings points to become Grandmaster Jouster.

data.name: Mogor's Champion
data.description: 50% chance to attack the wrong enemy.
data.flavorText: This champion has learned from the best.  Except for his target selection.

data.name: Mukla, Tyrant of the Vale
data.description: Battlecry: Add 2 Bananas to your hand.
data.flavorText: Pro tip: DO NOT BOGART THE BANANAS.

data.name: Mysterious Challenger
data.description: Battlecry: Put one of each Secret from your deck into the battlefield.
data.flavorText: He may sound surly and antisocial, but he's actually just really shy.

data.name: Nerubian Prophet
data.description: At the start of your turn, reduce this card'sCost by (1).
data.flavorText: It’s a self-reducing prophecy.

data.name: Priestess of Elune
data.description: Battlecry: Restore 4 Health to your hero.
data.flavorText: If she threatens to "moon" you, it's not what you think.

data.name: Reckless Rocketeer
data.description: Charge
data.flavorText: One Insane Rocketeer.   One Rocket full of Explosives.   Infinite Fun.

data.name: Reno Jackson
data.description: Battlecry: If your deck contains no more than 1 of any card, fully heal your hero.
data.flavorText: Reno is a four-time winner of the 'Best Accessorized Explorer' award.

data.name: Savannah Highmane
data.description: Deathrattle: Summon two 2/2 Hyenas.
data.flavorText: In the jungle, the mighty jungle, the lion gets slowly consumed by hyenas.

data.name: Scaled Nightmare
data.description: At the start of your turn, double this minion's Attack.
data.flavorText: I like it because it scales.

data.name: Sea Reaver
data.description: When you draw this, deal 1 damage to your minions.
data.flavorText: A little better than Sea Minus Reaver.

data.name: Sideshow Spelleater
data.description: Battlecry: Copy your opponent's Hero Power.
data.flavorText: Hey!  Let me try that...

data.name: Skeram Cultist
data.description: Battlecry: Give your C'Thun +2/+2 (wherever it is).
data.flavorText: Just before he comes into play, there is an AWESOME training montage with C'Thun.

data.name: Sunwalker
data.description: TauntDivine Shield
data.flavorText: She doesn’t ACTUALLY walk on the Sun.  It's just a name.  Don’t worry!

data.name: Sylvanas Windrunner
data.description: Deathrattle: Take control of a random enemy minion.
data.flavorText: Sylvanas was turned into the Banshee Queen by Arthas, but he probably should have just killed her because it just pissed her off.

data.name: Temple Enforcer
data.description: Battlecry: Give a friendly minion +3 Health.
data.flavorText: He also moonlights Thursday nights as a bouncer at the Pig and Whistle Tavern.

data.name: The Beast
data.description: Deathrattle: Summon a 3/3 Finkle Einhorn for your opponent.
data.flavorText: He lives in Blackrock Mountain.  He eats Gnomes.  That's pretty much it.

data.name: The Black Knight
data.description: Battlecry: Destroy an enemy minion with Taunt.
data.flavorText: He was sent by the Lich King to disrupt the Argent Tournament.   We can pretty much mark that a failure.

data.name: The Mistcaller
data.description: Battlecry: Give all minions in your hand and deck +1/+1.
data.flavorText: Calling the mist doesn't sound all that great.  "Ooooh, it is slightly damp now!"

data.name: The Skeleton Knight
data.description: Deathrattle: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, return this to your hand.
data.flavorText: Apparently it really was just a flesh wound.

data.name: Thing from Below
data.description: [x]TauntCosts (1) less for eachTotem you've summonedthis game.
data.flavorText: Just can't resist the opportunity to hang around with a bunch of totems.

data.name: Void Crusher
data.description: Inspire: Destroy a random minion for each player.
data.flavorText: We like to call him "Wesley".

data.name: Volcanic Drake
data.description: Costs (1) less for each minion that died this turn.
data.flavorText: Volcanic Drakes breathe lava instead of fire. The antacid vendor at Thorium Point does a brisk business with them.

data.name: Wilfred Fizzlebang
data.description: Cards you draw from your Hero Power cost (0).
data.flavorText:
He can summon anything, even a FEARSOME DOOMGUARD*.

*He's pretty sure this is going to work out.

data.name: Windfury Harpy
data.description: Windfury
data.flavorText: Harpies are not pleasant sounding.  That's the nicest I can put it.

data.name: Wobbling Runts
data.description: Deathrattle: Summon three 2/2 Runts.
data.flavorText: The fourth one fell off in a tragic accident.  They don't talk about it.

data.name: Arcanite Reaper
data.flavorText: No… actually you should fear the Reaper.

data.name: Assassin's Blade
data.flavorText: Guaranteed to have been owned by a real assassin.   Certificate of authenticity included.

data.name: Doomhammer
data.description: Windfury, Overload: (2)
data.flavorText: Orgrim Doomhammer gave this legendary weapon to Thrall.  His name is a total coincidence.

data.name: Hammer of Twilight
data.description: Deathrattle: Summon a 4/2 Elemental.
data.flavorText: Stop! It's Twilight Hammer time.

data.name: Tentacles for Arms
data.description: Deathrattle: Return this to your hand.
data.flavorText: That's right. Garrosh just slapped you to death with a tentacle.

data.name: Assassinate
data.description: Destroy an enemy minion.
data.flavorText: If you don't want to be assassinated, move to the Barrens and change your name. Good luck!

data.name: Bane of Doom
data.description: Deal 2 damage to a character. If that kills it, summon a random Demon.
data.flavorText: My advice to you is to avoid Doom, if possible.

data.name: Blessed Champion
data.description: Double a minion's Attack.
data.flavorText: This card causes double the trouble AND double the fun.

data.name: Bloodlust
data.description: Give your minions +3 Attack this turn.
data.flavorText: blaarghghLLGHRHARAAHAHHH!!

data.name: Brawl
data.description: Destroy all minions except one. (chosen randomly)
data.flavorText: Do you know the first rule of Brawl Club?

data.name: Cabalist's Tome
data.description: Add 3 random Mage spells to your hand.
data.flavorText: What's in there? I bet it's cookie recipes!

data.name: Dragon's Breath
data.description: Deal 4 damage. Costs (1) less for each minion that died this turn.
data.flavorText: Dragons breathe fire, sure, but did you know they can also breathe Cotton Candy?  It's harder to give them a reason to do that, though.

data.name: Excavated Evil
data.description: Deal 3 damage to all minions.Shuffle this card into your opponent's deck.
data.flavorText: MOM! DAD! DON'T TOUCH IT! IT'S EVIL!!!!!!

data.name: Explosive Shot
data.description: Deal 5 damage to a minion and 2 damage to adjacent ones.
data.flavorText: Pull the pin, count to 5, then shoot.  Then duck.

data.name: Flame Lance
data.description: Deal 8 damage to a minion.
data.flavorText: It's on the rack next to ice lance, acid lance, and English muffin lance.

data.name: Force of Nature
data.description: Summon three 2/2 Treants.
data.flavorText: "I think I'll just nap under these trees. Wait... AAAAAHHH!" - Blinkfizz, the Unfortunate Gnome

data.name: Holy Nova
data.description: Deal 2 damage to all enemies. Restore #2 Health to all friendly characters.
data.flavorText: If the Holy Light forsakes you, good luck casting this spell.  Also, you're probably a jerk.

data.name: Holy Wrath
data.description: Draw a card and deal damage equal to its cost.
data.flavorText: C'mon Molten Giant!!

data.name: Nourish
data.description: Choose One - Gain 2 Mana Crystals; or Draw 3 cards.
data.flavorText: Druids take nourishment from many things: the power of nature, the songbird's chirp, a chocolate cake.

data.name: Power Word: Tentacles
data.description: Give a minion +2/+6.
data.flavorText: Because you're wrapped in a protective layer of… tentacles?

data.name: Solemn Vigil
data.description: Draw 2 cards. Costs (1) less for each minion that died this turn.
data.flavorText: Each year, folk gather in front of Blackrock Mountain to mourn those who were mind-controlled into the lava.

data.name: Stand Against Darkness
data.description: Summon five 1/1 Silver Hand Recruits.
data.flavorText: Or if you're too tired, you can just kind of lean against the darkness.

data.name: Starfall
data.description: Choose One - Deal 5 damage to a minion; or 2 damage to all enemy minions.
data.flavorText: Is the sky falling?  Yes.  Yes it is.

data.name: Abomination
data.description: Taunt. Deathrattle: Deal 2 damage to ALL characters.
data.flavorText: Abominations enjoy Fresh Meat and long walks on the beach.

data.name: Anubisath Sentinel
data.description: Deathrattle: Give a random friendly minion +3/+3.
data.flavorText: He's actually a 1/1 who picked up the hammer from the last guy.

data.name: Azure Drake
data.description: Spell Damage +1. Battlecry: Draw a card.
data.flavorText: They initially planned to be the Beryl or Cerulean drakes, but those felt a tad too pretentious.

data.name: Big Game Hunter
data.description: Battlecry: Destroy a minion with an Attack of 7 or more.
data.flavorText: Mere devilsaurs no longer excite him.  Soon he'll be trying to catch Onyxia with only a dull Krol Blade.

data.name: Blackwing Corruptor
data.description: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, deal 3 damage.
data.flavorText: He got his name when he gave Blackwing some comic books and rock & roll records.

data.name: Booty Bay Bodyguard
data.description: Taunt
data.flavorText: You can hire him... until someone offers him enough gold to turn on you.

data.name: Captain Greenskin
data.description: Battlecry: Give your weapon +1/+1.
data.flavorText: He was this close to piloting a massive juggernaut into Stormwind Harbor. If it weren't for those pesky kids!

data.name: Clockwork Knight
data.description: Battlecry: Give a friendly Mech +1/+1.
data.flavorText: It takes a lot to wind him up.

data.name: Corrupted Healbot
data.description: Deathrattle: Restore 8 Health to the enemy hero.
data.flavorText: Not so much "corrupted" as "has terrible aim".

data.name: Crazed Worshipper
data.description: Taunt. Whenever this minion takes damage, give your C'Thun +1/+1 (wherever it is).
data.flavorText: Every month they share a pancake breakfast with the Perfectly Rational Worshippers.

data.name: Cult Apothecary
data.description: Battlecry: For each enemy minion, restore 2 Health to your hero.
data.flavorText: Cults need pharmacists too.

data.name: Dark Iron Skulker
data.description: Battlecry: Deal 2 damage to all undamaged enemy minions.
data.flavorText: He loves skulking. He skulks after hours just for the joy of it, but his friends are pretty worried he'll get burnt out.

data.name: Darkscale Healer
data.description: Battlecry: Restore 2 Health to all friendly characters.
data.flavorText: Healing is just something she does in her free time.  It's more of a hobby really.

data.name: Darkshire Alchemist
data.description: Battlecry: Restore 5 Health.
data.flavorText: The secret ingredient: liquified funnel cake.

data.name: Darkspeaker
data.description: Battlecry: Swap stats with a friendly minion.
data.flavorText: People often think that Darkspeaker is the arch nemesis of Lightspeaker, but that title actually belongs to Heavyspeaker.

data.name: Djinni of Zephyrs
data.description: After you cast a spell on another friendly minion, cast a copy of it on this one.
data.flavorText: If you want your wish granted, don't rub him the wrong way.

data.name: Doomguard
data.description: Charge. Battlecry: Discard two random cards.
data.flavorText: Summoning a doomguard is risky. Someone is going to die.

data.name: Dragon Consort
data.description: Battlecry: The next Dragon you play costs (2) less.
data.flavorText: Everybody wants someone to snuggle with. Even giant armored scaly draconic beasts of destruction.

data.name: Druid of the Claw
data.description: Choose One - Charge; or +2 Health and Taunt.
data.flavorText: Cat or Bear?  Cat or Bear?!  I just cannot CHOOSE!

data.name: Earth Elemental
data.description: Taunt. Overload: (3)
data.flavorText: Nothing beats rock.

data.name: Ethereal Conjurer
data.description: Battlecry: Discover a spell.
data.flavorText: Despite the name, he's a solid conjurer.

data.name: Faceless Manipulator
data.description: Battlecry: Choose a minion and become a copy of it.
data.flavorText: The Faceless Ones are servants of Yogg-Saron, and they feed on fear. Right now they are feeding on your fear of accidentally disenchanting all your good cards.

data.name: Fen Creeper
data.description: Taunt
data.flavorText: He used to be called Bog Beast, but it confused people because he wasn't an actual beast.   Boom, New Name!

data.name: Frostwolf Warlord
data.description: Battlecry: Gain +1/+1 for each other friendly minion on the battlefield.
data.flavorText: The Frostwolves are locked in combat with the Stormpike Expedition over control of Alterac Valley.  Every attempt at peace-talks has ended with Captain Galvangar killing the mediator.

data.name: Grim Patron
data.description: Whenever this minion survives damage, summon another Grim Patron.
data.flavorText: If you love getting your face punched, come to the Grim Guzzler!

data.name: Gurubashi Berserker
data.description: Whenever this minion takes damage, gain +3 Attack.
data.flavorText: No Pain, No Gain.

data.name: Hallazeal the Ascended
data.description: Whenever your spells deal damage, restore that much Health to your hero.
data.flavorText: Hallazeals all your dallazamage.

data.name: Harrison Jones
data.description: Battlecry: Destroy your opponent's weapon and draw cards equal to its Durability.
data.flavorText: “That belongs in the Hall of Explorers!”

data.name: Kvaldir Raider
data.description: Inspire: Gain +2/+2.
data.flavorText: Coming soon... to a tuskarr village near you!

data.name: Leeroy Jenkins
data.description: Charge. Battlecry: Summon two 1/1 Whelps for your opponent.
data.flavorText: At least he has Angry Chicken.

data.name: Mukla's Champion
data.description: Inspire: Give your other minions +1/+1.
data.flavorText: An elegant gorilla, for a more civilized age.

data.name: Naga Sea Witch
data.description: Your cards cost (5).
data.flavorText: If she had studied harder, she would have been a C+ witch.

data.name: Nexus-Champion Saraad
data.description: Inspire: Add a random spell to your hand.
data.flavorText: The ethereals have their own jousting tournament, and Saraad is the reigning champion.  Also he won the ethereal hot dog eating contest.

data.name: Nightblade
data.description: Battlecry: Deal 3 damage to the enemy hero.
data.flavorText: Your face is the place you'd probably least like a dagger, and where rogues are most likely to deliver them.

data.name: Pit Fighter
data.flavorText: What did the pits ever do to you?

data.name: Princess Huhuran
data.description: Battlecry: Trigger a friendly minion's Deathrattle effect.
data.flavorText: She flitters around Ahn'Qiraj dreaming of the day she will meet a sweet prince, whom she can lay thousands of eggs with.

data.name: Psych-o-Tron
data.description: TauntDivine Shield
data.flavorText: "Annoyinger-o-Tron" was just too unwieldy. And accurate.

data.name: Ram Wrangler
data.description: Battlecry: If you have a Beast, summon arandom Beast.
data.flavorText: Not getting trampled is really the trick here.

data.name: Recruiter
data.description: Inspire: Add a 2/2 Squire to your hand.
data.flavorText: Join the Argent Crusade!  We have attractive tabards and you get to carry really nice swords!

data.name: Servant of Yogg-Saron
data.description: Battlecry: Cast a random spell that costs (5) or less (targets chosen randomly).
data.flavorText: Yogg-Saron always likes to complain about how he has too many servants and there are too many mouths to feed.

data.name: Shado-Pan Rider
data.description: Combo: Gain +3 Attack.
data.flavorText: He needed a break after that business in the Vale of Eternal Blossoms. Naturally, he chose to spend his vacation in an icy snowscape killing monsters.

data.name: Shadowcaster
data.description: Battlecry: Choose a friendly minion. Add a 1/1 copy     to your hand that costs (1).
data.flavorText: I mean, it's not creepy if you ASK before you steal their shadow to make a small replica of them to keep on your shelf.

data.name: Silver Hand Knight
data.description: Battlecry: Summon a 2/2 Squire.
data.flavorText: It's good to be a knight.   Less so to be one's squire.

data.name: Spiteful Smith
data.description: Enrage: Your weapon has +2 Attack.
data.flavorText: She'll craft you a sword, but you'll need to bring her 5 Steel Ingots, 3 Motes of Earth, and the scalp of her last customer.

data.name: Stampeding Kodo
data.description: Battlecry: Destroy a random enemy minion with 2 or less Attack.
data.flavorText: This Kodo is so big that he can stampede by himself.

data.name: Starving Buzzard
data.description: Whenever you summon a Beast, draw a card.
data.flavorText: If you feed him, he loses his whole identity.

data.name: Stormpike Commando
data.description: Battlecry: Deal 2 damage.
data.flavorText: The Stormpike Commandos are demolition experts.  They also bake a mean cupcake.

data.name: Stranglethorn Tiger
data.description: Stealth
data.flavorText: The wonderful thing about tigers is tigers are wonderful things!

data.name: Summoning Stone
data.description: Whenever you cast a spell, summon a random minion of the same Cost.
data.flavorText: Sometimes it feels like it's always the same slackers that are waiting for a summon.

data.name: Thunder Bluff Valiant
data.description: Inspire: Give your Totems +2 Attack.
data.flavorText: Allowing totems to attack is not cheating.  I mean, there isn't anything in the rule books about it.

data.name: Tundra Rhino
data.description: Your Beasts have Charge.
data.flavorText: Tundra rhinos are often mistaken for kodos.  Or am I mistaken?

data.name: Tuskarr Jouster
data.description: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, restore 7 Health to your hero.
data.flavorText: Just could not be talked out of using his turtle for the joust...

data.name: Twilight Darkmender
data.description: Battlecry: If your C'Thun  has at least 10 Attack, restore 10 Health to your hero.
data.flavorText: First she separates them from the lights, washes them in cold water, and hang-dries.

data.name: Usher of Souls
data.description: Whenever a friendly minion dies, give your C'Thun +1/+1(wherever it is).
data.flavorText: Nothing unburdens your soul like a good ushing!

data.name: Validated Doomsayer
data.description: At the start of your turn, set this minion's Attack to 7.
data.flavorText: Really feels good about himself and is in a much better place now. But… he sure does miss piloting those shredders.

data.name: Venture Co. Mercenary
data.description: Your minions cost (3) more.
data.flavorText: No Job is too big.  No fee is too big.

data.name: Charged Hammer
data.description: Deathrattle: Your Hero Power becomes 'Deal 2 damage.'
data.flavorText: You can only pick it up if you are worthy.

data.name: Poisoned Blade
data.description: Your Hero Power gives this weapon +1 Attack instead of replacing it.
data.flavorText: How much more poisoned can a blade get?  The answer is a lot.  A lot more poisoned.

data.name: Truesilver Champion
data.description: Whenever your hero attacks, restore 2 Health to it.
data.flavorText: It Slices, it Dices. You can cut a tin can with it. (But you wouldn't want to.)

data.name: Astral Communion
data.description: Gain 10 Mana Crystals. Discard your hand.
data.flavorText: Hey!  Moon!  Can I have some mana crystals?

data.name: Bite
data.description: Give your hero +4 Attack this turn and 4 Armor.
data.flavorText: Chew your food!

data.name: Blade Flurry
data.description: Destroy your weapon and deal its damage to all enemy minions.
data.flavorText: "Look, it's not just about waving daggers around really fast.  It's a lot more complicated than that." - Shan, Rogue Trainer

data.name: Blessing of Kings
data.description: Give a minion +4/+4. (+4 Attack/+4 Health)
data.flavorText: Given the number of kings who have been assassinated, are you sure you want their blessing?

data.name: Cone of Cold
data.description: Freeze a minion and the minions next to it, and deal 1 damage to them.
data.flavorText: Magi of the Kirin Tor were casting Cubes of Cold for many years before Cones came into fashion some 90 years ago.

data.name: Consecration
data.description: Deal 2 damage to all enemies.
data.flavorText: Consecrated ground glows with Holy energy.  But it smells a little, too.

data.name: Fireball
data.description: Deal 6 damage.
data.flavorText: This spell is useful for burning things.  If you're looking for spells that toast things, or just warm them a little, you're in the wrong place.

data.name: Fist of Jaraxxus
data.description: When you play or discard this, deal 4 damage to a random enemy.
data.flavorText: * Not actually Jaraxxus' fist.

data.name: Hammer of Wrath
data.description: Deal 3 damage.Draw a card.
data.flavorText: A good paladin has many tools.  Hammer of Wrath, Pliers of Vengeance, Hacksaw of Justice, etc.

data.name: Hellfire
data.description: Deal 3 damage to ALL characters.
data.flavorText: It's spells like these that make it hard for Warlocks to get decent help.

data.name: Mass Dispel
data.description: Silence all enemy minions. Draw a card.
data.flavorText: It dispels buffs, powers, hopes, and dreams.

data.name: Mindgames
data.description: Put a copy of a random minion from your opponent's deck into the battlefield.
data.flavorText: Sometimes it feels like this is all a game.

data.name: Mortal Strike
data.description: Deal 4 damage. If you have 12 or less Health, deal 6 instead.
data.flavorText: "If you only use one ability, use Mortal Strike." - The Warrior Code, Line 6

data.name: Multi-Shot
data.description: Deal 3 damage to two random enemy minions.
data.flavorText: You see, it's all about throughput.

data.name: Polymorph
data.description: Transform a minion into a 1/1 Sheep.
data.flavorText: There was going to be a pun in this flavor text, but it just came out baa-d.

data.name: Shadow Madness
data.description: Gain control of an enemy minion with 3 or less Attack until end of turn.
data.flavorText: You can rationalize it all you want, it's still a mean thing to do.

data.name: Shadow Word: Horror
data.description: Destroy all minions with 2 or less Attack.
data.flavorText: It's more succinct than "Shadow Word: Suck Into Vortex."

data.name: Shadowflame
data.description: Destroy a friendly minion and deal its Attack damage to all enemy minions.
data.flavorText: Start with a powerful minion and stir in Shadowflame and you have a good time!

data.name: Soul of the Forest
data.description: Give your minions "Deathrattle: Summon a 2/2 Treant."
data.flavorText: "Reforestation" is suddenly a terrifying word.

data.name: Swipe
data.description: Deal 4 damage to an enemy and 1 damage to all other enemies.
data.flavorText: When a bear rears back and extends his arms, he's about to Swipe!  ... or hug.

data.name: Aberrant Berserker
data.description: Enrage: +2 Attack.
data.flavorText: I berserk, therefore I am.

data.name: Ancient Brewmaster
data.description: Battlecry: Return a friendly minion from the battlefield to your hand.
data.flavorText: Most pandaren say his brew tastes like yak.  But apparently that's a compliment.

data.name: Ancient Mage
data.description: Battlecry: Give adjacent minions Spell Damage +1.
data.flavorText: Sometimes he forgets and just wanders into someone else's game.

data.name: Ancient Shade
data.description: Battlecry: Shuffle an 'Ancient Curse' into your deck that deals 7 damage to you when drawn.
data.flavorText: Warning: Do not expose to direct sunlight.

data.name: Animated Armor
data.description: Your hero can only take 1 damage at a time.
data.flavorText: Try putting it on.  Wait, let me get my camera.

data.name: Arathi Weaponsmith
data.description: Battlecry: Equip a 2/2 weapon.
data.flavorText: 50% off fist weapons, limited time only!

data.name: Armored Warhorse
data.description: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, gain Charge.
data.flavorText: Yep.  It's a horse... wearing armor... going to war.

data.name: Auchenai Soulpriest
data.description: Your cards and powers that restore Health now deal damage instead.
data.flavorText: The Auchenai know the end is coming, but they're not sure when.

data.name: Axe Flinger
data.description: Whenever this minion takes damage, deal 2 damage to the enemy hero.
data.flavorText: Once a lowly "Stick Flinger", he's been relentless on the path to his ultimate dream: "Tauren Flinger".

data.name: Blackwater Pirate
data.description: Your weapons cost (2) less.
data.flavorText: "Look, they fell off the back of a ship, do you want them or not? I have a meeting with Y'Shaarj in like ten minutes."

data.name: Bloodhoof Brave
data.description: TauntEnrage: +3 Attack.
data.flavorText: He thought the set was called "Flippers of the Old Cods" and hungrily volunteered to be in it.  He is definitely going to get his hearing checked.

data.name: Chillwind Yeti
data.flavorText: He always dreamed of coming down from the mountains and opening a noodle shop, but he never got the nerve.

data.name: Core Rager
data.description: Battlecry: If your hand is empty, gain +3/+3.
data.flavorText: It takes a special kind of hunter to venture deep into a firey lava pit and convince a monster who lives there to come home and be a cuddly housepet.

data.name: Crowd Favorite
data.description: Whenever you play a card with Battlecry, gain +1/+1.
data.flavorText: The crowd ALWAYS yells lethal.

data.name: C'Thun's Chosen
data.description: [x]Divine ShieldBattlecry: Give your C'Thun+2/+2 (wherever it is).
data.flavorText: He gave her a promise ring and everything.

data.name: Cult Master
data.description: Whenever one of your other minions dies, draw a card.
data.flavorText: She may be an evil cult master, but she still calls her parents once a week.

data.name: Cyclopian Horror
data.description: Taunt. Battlecry: Gain      +1 Health for each enemy minion.
data.flavorText: What are the qualifications for being a 'Horror?'  Just how horrible do you have to be?

data.name: Dalaran Aspirant
data.description: Inspire: Gain Spell Damage +1.
data.flavorText: Is he aspiring or inspiring?  Make up your mind!

data.name: Dark Iron Dwarf
data.description: Battlecry: Give a minion +2 Attack this turn.
data.flavorText: Guardians of Dark Iron Ore.  Perhaps the most annoying ore, given where you have to forge it.

data.name: Defender of Argus
data.description: Battlecry: Give adjacent minions +1/+1 and Taunt.
data.flavorText: You wouldn’t think that Argus would need this much defending.  But it does.

data.name: Demented Frostcaller
data.description: After you cast a spell, Freeze a random enemy.
data.flavorText: He prefers that you refer to him by his nickname: 'Frostwaker.'

data.name: Draenei Totemcarver
data.description: Battlecry: Gain +1/+1 for each friendly Totem.
data.flavorText: It's nice to find a real craftsman in this day and age of mass-produced totems.

data.name: Dragonkin Sorcerer
data.description: Whenever you target this minion with a spell, gain +1/+1.
data.flavorText: Dragonkin Sorcerers be all "I'm a wizard" and everyone else be all "daaaaang".

data.name: Dragonling Mechanic
data.description: Battlecry: Summon a 2/1 Mechanical Dragonling.
data.flavorText: She is still working on installing the rocket launcher add-on for Mr. Bitey.

data.name: Dread Corsair
data.description: Taunt. Costs (1) less per Attack of your weapon.
data.flavorText: "Yarrrr" is a pirate word that means "Greetings, milord."

data.name: Dreadsteed
data.description: Deathrattle: Summon a Dreadsteed.
data.flavorText: Crescendo himself summoned this steed, riding it to victory in the Grand Tournament.  Wherever he rides, an army of riders ride behind him, supporting the legendary champion.

data.name: Eater of Secrets
data.description: Battlecry: Destroy all enemy Secrets. Gain +1/+1 for each.
data.flavorText: You don't want to be around after it has eaten an explosive trap.  You thought Sludge Belcher was bad...

data.name: Eerie Statue
data.description: Can’t attack unless it’s the only minion in the battlefield.
data.flavorText: Don't blink!  Don't turn your back, don't look away, and DON'T BLINK.

data.name: Elise Starseeker
data.description: Battlecry: Shuffle the 'Map to the Golden Monkey'   into your deck.
data.flavorText: A large part of her job entails not mixing up the Map to the Golden Monkey with the Map to Monkey Island.

data.name: Ethereal Arcanist
data.description: If you control a Secret at the end of your turn, gain +2/+2.
data.flavorText: The ethereals are wrapped in cloth to give form to their non-corporeal bodies. Also because it's nice and soft.

data.name: Evil Heckler
data.description: Taunt
data.flavorText: To be honest, heckling is not the most effective form of evil.

data.name: Evolved Kobold
data.description: Spell Damage +2
data.flavorText: You no take tentacle!

data.name: Faceless Shambler
data.description: TauntBattlecry: Copy a friendly minion's Attack and Health.
data.flavorText: "What is that thing?!" "I'm not sure, but it seems to be sort of Y'sera shaped."

data.name: Fandral Staghelm
data.description: Your Choose One cards have both effects combined.
data.flavorText: Always manages to mention "Back when I was creating the World Tree…" in EVERY conversation. Sheesh! Enough already.

data.name: Fireguard Destroyer
data.description: Battlecry: Gain 1-4 Attack. Overload: (1)
data.flavorText: Ragnaros interviews hundreds of Fire Elementals for the position of "Destroyer" but very few have what it takes.

data.name: Flamewreathed Faceless
data.description: Overload: (2)
data.flavorText: He's on fire! Boomshakalaka!

data.name: Frigid Snobold
data.description: Spell Damage +1
data.flavorText: Ironically, the natural enemy of the snobold is THE CANDLE.

data.name: Gnomish Inventor
data.description: Battlecry: Draw a card.
data.flavorText: She's never quite sure what she's making, she just knows it's AWESOME!

data.name: Gorillabot A-3
data.description: Battlecry: If you control another Mech, Discover a Mech.
data.flavorText: A-1 and A-2 went nuts, when they should have gone bolts.

data.name: Gormok the Impaler
data.description: Battlecry: If you have at least 4 other minions, deal 4 damage.
data.flavorText: Gormok has been giving impaling lessons in a small tent near the tournament grounds.  For only 25g you too could learn the fine art of impaling!

data.name: Holy Champion
data.description: Whenever a character is healed, gain +2 Attack.
data.flavorText: She really likes seeing people get better.  That's why she hurts them in the first place.

data.name: Hooded Acolyte
data.description: Whenever a character is healed, give yourC'Thun +1/+1 (wherever it is).
data.flavorText: Wait, what kind of acolyte doesn't wear a hood?

data.name: Houndmaster
data.description: Battlecry: Give a friendly Beast +2/+2 and Taunt.
data.flavorText: "Who let the dogs out?" he asks.  It's rhetorical.

data.name: Hungry Dragon
data.description: Battlecry: Summon a random 1-Cost minion for your opponent.
data.flavorText: Hungry Hungry Dragon is NOT a fun game.

data.name: Infested Tauren
data.description: TauntDeathrattle: Summon a 2/2 Slime.
data.flavorText: The Overmind and the Old Gods are surprisingly similar.

data.name: Infested Wolf
data.description: Deathrattle: Summon two 1/1 Spiders.
data.flavorText: A little flea powder will fix that right up.

data.name: Jungle Moonkin
data.description: Both players haveSpell Damage +2.
data.flavorText: The REAL angry chicken!

data.name: Keeper of the Grove
data.description: Choose One - Deal 2 damage; or Silence a minion.
data.flavorText: These guys just show up and start Keeping your Groves without even asking.

data.name: Keeper of Uldaman
data.description: Battlecry: Set a minion's Attack and Health to 3.
data.flavorText: U da man!  No, U da man!

data.name: Klaxxi Amber-Weaver
data.description: Battlecry: If your C'Thun has at least 10 Attack, gain +5 Health.
data.flavorText: Amberweaving is a specialty course at the local trade school.

data.name: Kor'kron Elite
data.description: Charge
data.flavorText: The Kor'kron are the elite forces of Garrosh Hellscream. Let's just say you don't want to run into these guys while wearing a blue tabard.

data.name: Lightspawn
data.description: This minion's Attack is always equal to its Health.
data.flavorText: Spawn of the Light? Or Pawn of the Lights?

data.name: Magnataur Alpha
data.description: Also damages the minions next to whomeverhe attacks.
data.flavorText: Playing him also gets you into the Magnataur Beta.

data.name: Maiden of the Lake
data.description: Your Hero Power costs (1).
data.flavorText: Not a good basis for a system of government.

data.name: Master of Disguise
data.description: Battlecry: Give a friendly minion Stealth until your next turn.
data.flavorText: She's actually a male tauren.  People don't call him "Master of Disguise" for nothing.

data.name: Master of Evolution
data.description: Battlecry: Transform a friendly minion into a random one that costs (1) more.
data.flavorText: Will be really useful in the new "Hearthémon" game.

data.name: Midnight Drake
data.description: Battlecry: Gain +1 Attack for each other cardin your hand.
data.flavorText: Still fearsome in the daytime.

data.name: Mire Keeper
data.description: [x]Choose One -Summon a2/2 Slime; or Gain anempty Mana Crystal.
data.flavorText:
"Hey.... Is that Mire for sale?" 
"No.  I'm keeping it."

data.name: Mogu'shan Warden
data.description: Taunt
data.flavorText: All these guys ever do is talk about the Thunder King.   BOOOORRRINNG!

data.name: Murloc Knight
data.description: Inspire: Summon a random Murloc.
data.flavorText: Hee hee!  Look at his cute little feet.

data.name: Oasis Snapjaw
data.flavorText: His dreams of flying and breathing fire like his idol will never be realized.

data.name: Ogre Magi
data.description: Spell Damage +1
data.flavorText: Training Ogres in the art of spellcasting is a questionable decision.

data.name: Pit Lord
data.description: Battlecry: Deal 5 damage to your hero.
data.flavorText: Mannoroth, Magtheridon, and Brutallus may be dead, but it turns out there are a LOT of pit lords.

data.name: Polluted Hoarder
data.description: Deathrattle: Draw a card.
data.flavorText: Roll ‘greed’ OR THIS COULD HAPPEN TO YOU.

data.name: Refreshment Vendor
data.description: Battlecry: Restore 4 Health to each hero.
data.flavorText: Menu:  Funnel cakes, carrots, popcorn, jormungar steaks.  It's hard serving a diverse clientele.

data.name: Rumbling Elemental
data.description: After you play a Battlecry minion, deal 2 damage to a random enemy.
data.flavorText: He's a very hungry elemental.

data.name: Savage Combatant
data.description: Inspire: Give your hero+2 Attack this turn.
data.flavorText: Maybe if you whistle a tune it will soothe him.  Yeah...  Try that.

data.name: Sen'jin Shieldmasta
data.description: Taunt
data.flavorText: Sen'jin Villiage is nice, if you like trolls and dust.

data.name: Shifting Shade
data.description: Deathrattle: Copy a card from your opponent's deck and add it to your hand.
data.flavorText: Yeah, it's cooler in the shade, but you're also more likely to get JACKED.

data.name: Silvermoon Guardian
data.description: Divine Shield
data.flavorText: The first time they tried to guard Silvermoon against the scourge, it didn’t go so well…

data.name: Southsea Squidface
data.description: Deathrattle: Give your weapon +2 Attack.
data.flavorText: Quick! Before I drown! Let me sharpen your sword for you.

data.name: Spawn of Shadows
data.description: Inspire: Deal 4 damage to each hero.
data.flavorText: What did you expect to happen?  He's a Spawn.  Of Shadows.

data.name: Spellbreaker
data.description: Battlecry: Silence a minion.
data.flavorText: Spellbreakers can rip enchantments from magic-wielders.  The process is painless and can be performed on an outpatient basis.

data.name: Stormwind Knight
data.description: Charge
data.flavorText: They're still embarassed about "The Deathwing Incident".

data.name: Summoning Portal
data.description: Your minions cost (2) less, but not less than (1).
data.flavorText: NOT LESS THAN 1!  Don't get any ideas!

data.name: Tomb Pillager
data.description: Deathrattle: Add a Coin to your hand.
data.flavorText: After the guild broke up, he could no longer raid the tombs.

data.name: Tomb Spider
data.description: Battlecry: Discover a Beast.
data.flavorText: Less serious than its cousin, the Grave Spider.

data.name: Tournament Medic
data.description: Inspire: Restore 2 Health to your hero.
data.flavorText: The medic tournament is less entertaining than the Grand Tournament.

data.name: Twilight Drake
data.description: Battlecry: Gain +1 Health for each card in your hand.
data.flavorText: Twilight drakes feed on Mystical Energy.  And Tacos.

data.name: Twilight Guardian
data.description: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, gain +1 Attack and Taunt.
data.flavorText: A result of magical experiments carried out by the Black Dragonflight, it's not his fault that he's a vicious killer.

data.name: Twilight Summoner
data.description: Deathrattle: Summon a 5/5 Faceless Destroyer.
data.flavorText: If you strike him down, he shall become more powerful than you can possibly imagine.

data.name: Violet Teacher
data.description: Whenever you cast a spell, summon a 1/1 Violet Apprentice.
data.flavorText: If you don't pay attention, you may be turned into a pig.  And then you get your name on the board.

data.name: Water Elemental
data.description: Freeze any character damaged by this minion.
data.flavorText: Don't summon a water elemental at a party.  It'll dampen the mood.

data.name: Wildwalker
data.description: Battlecry: Give a friendly Beast +3 Health.
data.flavorText: She was born to be something.  She is just not quite sure what yet...

data.name: Windspeaker
data.description: Battlecry: Give a friendly minion Windfury.
data.flavorText: Is there anything worse than a Windspeaker with halitosis?

data.name: Xaril, Poisoned Mind
data.description: Battlecry and Deathrattle: Add a random Toxin card to your hand.
data.flavorText: It's basically your own fault if you go around drinking weird green potions handed out by creepy mantid dudes.

data.name: Eaglehorn Bow
data.description: Whenever a friendly Secret is revealed, gain +1 Durability.
data.flavorText: First Lesson: Put the pointy end in the other guy.

data.name: King's Defender
data.description: Battlecry: If you have a minion with Taunt,  gain +1 Durability.
data.flavorText: "King's Attacker" is a shield.  Funny, huh?

data.name: Perdition's Blade
data.description: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage. Combo: Deal 2 instead.
data.flavorText: Perdition's Blade is Ragnaros's back-up weapon while Sulfuras is in the shop.

data.name: Rallying Blade
data.description: Battlecry: Give +1/+1 to your minions with Divine Shield.
data.flavorText: As far as blades go, this one is pretty great in the motivation department.

data.name: Sword of Justice
data.description: After you summon a minion, give it +1/+1 and this loses 1 Durability.
data.flavorText: I dub you Sir Loin of Beef!

data.name: Animal Companion
data.description: Summon a random Beast Companion.
data.flavorText: You could summon Misha, Leokk, or Huffer!  Huffer is more trouble than he's worth.

data.name: Arcane Intellect
data.description: Draw 2 cards.
data.flavorText: Playing this card makes you SMARTER.  And let's face it: we could all stand to be a little smarter.

data.name: Bash
data.description: Deal 3 damage.Gain 3 Armor.
data.flavorText: You might think bashing doesn't take a lot of practice.  It doesn't.

data.name: Beneath the Grounds
data.description: Shuffle 3 Ambushes into your opponent's deck. When drawn, you summon a 4/4 Nerubian.
data.flavorText: Can you hold these eggs for just a second?  I promise they're not full of giant enraged undead spider things.

data.name: Blood Warriors
data.description: Add a copy of each damaged friendly minion to your hand.
data.flavorText: They have an uneasy rivalry with the Blood Paladins.

data.name: Burgle
data.description: Add 2 random class cards to your hand (from your opponent's class).
data.flavorText: Yoink!

data.name: Charge
data.description: Give a friendly minion +2 Attack and Charge.
data.flavorText: "Guys! Guys! Slow down!" - some kind of non-warrior minion

data.name: Counterspell
data.description: Secret: When your opponent casts a spell, Counter it.
data.flavorText: What's the difference between a mage playing with Counterspell and a mage who isn't?  The mage who isn't is getting Pyroblasted in the face.

data.name: Deadly Shot
data.description: Destroy a random enemy minion.
data.flavorText: Accuracy is not a highly valued trait among the mok'nathal.  Deadliness is near the top, though.

data.name: Demonwrath
data.description: Deal 2 damage to all non-Demon minions.
data.flavorText: Demons are not angry most of the time. You have to play this card in order to really bring it out of them.

data.name: Divine Favor
data.description: Draw cards until you have as many in hand as your opponent.
data.flavorText: This is not just a favor, but a divine one, like helping someone move a couch with a fold out bed!

data.name: Drain Life
data.description: Deal 2 damage. Restore #2 Health to your hero.
data.flavorText: "I've just sucked one year of your life away."

data.name: Effigy
data.description: Secret: When a friendly minion dies, summon a random minion with the same Cost.
data.flavorText: Burning man, brah.

data.name: Elemental Destruction
data.description: Deal 4-5 damage to all minions. Overload: (5),
data.flavorText: I'm not a shaman or anything, but isn't Elemental Destruction the opposite of what they want to do?

data.name: Fan of Knives
data.description: Deal 1 damage to all enemy minions. Draw a card.
data.flavorText: I wouldn't say I LOVE knives, but I'm definitely a fan.

data.name: Far Sight
data.description: Draw a card. That card costs (3) less.
data.flavorText: Drek'thar can't see, but he can see. You know what I mean? It's ok if you don't.

data.name: Feral Rage
data.description: Choose One - Give your hero +4 Attack this turn; or Gain 8 Armor.
data.flavorText: Let's be honest. One option is a lot ragier than the other.

data.name: Feral Spirit
data.description: Summon two 2/3 Spirit Wolves with Taunt. Overload: (2)
data.flavorText: Spirit wolves are like regular wolves with pom-poms.

data.name: Forgotten Torch
data.description: Deal 3 damage. Shuffle a 'Roaring Torch' into your deck that deals 6 damage.
data.flavorText: Why does a forgotten torch turn into a roaring torch with no provocation?  It's one of life's many mysteries.

data.name: Frost Nova
data.description: Freeze all enemy minions.
data.flavorText: Hey man, that's cold.  Literally and metaphorically.

data.name: Headcrack
data.description: Deal 2 damage to the enemy hero. Combo: Return this to your hand next turn.
data.flavorText: When all else fails, nothing beats a swift whack upside the head.

data.name: Healing Touch
data.description: Restore #8 Health.
data.flavorText: 8 Health, no waiting.

data.name: Healing Wave
data.description: Restore #7 Health. Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, Restore #14 instead.
data.flavorText: Favored by shaman who study the art of restoration and healing, this spell would feel smug, if it had feelings.

data.name: Hex
data.description: Transform a minion into a 0/1 Frog with Taunt.
data.flavorText: If you Hex a Murloc... it really isn't much of a change, is it?

data.name: Ice Barrier
data.description: Secret: When your hero is attacked, gain 8 Armor.
data.flavorText: This is Rank 1.  Rank 2 is Chocolate Milk Barrier.

data.name: Ice Block
data.description: Secret: When your hero takes fatal damage, prevent it and become Immune this turn.
data.flavorText: Ice is nice, and will suffice!

data.name: Infest
data.description: Give your minions "Deathrattle: Add a random Beast to your hand."
data.flavorText: The best part is the look on their face when you jump out of the cake! Err… corpse.

data.name: Kill Command
data.description: Deal 3 damage. If you have a Beast, deal 5 damage instead.
data.flavorText: "Kill!", he commanded.

data.name: Lava Burst
data.description: Deal 5 damage. Overload: (2)
data.flavorText: It's like an ocean of liquid magma in your mouth!

data.name: Lightning Storm
data.description: Deal 2-3 damage to all enemy minions. Overload: (2)
data.flavorText: An umbrella won't be effective, I'm afraid.

data.name: Mark of Nature
data.description: Choose One - Give a minion +4 Attack; or +4 Health and Taunt.
data.flavorText: Druids call it the "Mark of Nature."  Everyone else calls it "needing a bath."

data.name: Mirror Entity
data.description: Secret: After your opponent plays a minion, summon a copy of it.
data.flavorText: "You go first." - Krush'gor the Behemoth, to his pet boar.

data.name: Mulch
data.description: Destroy a minion.Add a random minion to your opponent's hand.
data.flavorText: Is this a noun or a verb?  We will never know.

data.name: Polymorph: Boar
data.description: Transform a minion into a 4/2 Boar with Charge.
data.flavorText: It's always Huffer.

data.name: Powershot
data.description: Deal 2 damage to a minion and the minions next to it.
data.flavorText: pow POW pow

data.name: Savage Roar
data.description: Give your characters +2 Attack this turn.
data.flavorText: What do they roar? Nobody can quite tell, but it sounds like "Elephant Macho Breeze".  It's probably not that, though.

data.name: Seal of Champions
data.description: Give a minion+3 Attack and Divine Shield.
data.flavorText: "Arf! Arf! Arf!" - Seal of Champions

data.name: Sense Demons
data.description: Put 2 random Demons from your deck into your hand.
data.flavorText: Generally demons are pretty obvious and you don’t need a spell to sense them.

data.name: Shadow Bolt
data.description: Deal 4 damage to a minion.
data.flavorText: It’s a Bolt.   It's made out of Shadow.   What more do you need to know!

data.name: Shadow Strike
data.description: Deal 5 damage to an undamaged character.
data.flavorText: It's like a backstab, only from the front. And with two more stabs.

data.name: Shadow Word: Death
data.description: Destroy a minion with an Attack of 5 or more.
data.flavorText: If you miss, it leaves a lightning-bolt-shaped scar on your target.

data.name: Shadowform
data.description: Your Hero Power becomes 'Deal 2 damage'. If already in Shadowform: 3 damage.
data.flavorText: If a bright light shines on a priest in Shadowform… do they cast a shadow?

data.name: Shield Block
data.description: Gain 5 Armor.Draw a card.
data.flavorText: Shields were invented because Face Block is USELESS.

data.name: Spellbender
data.description: Secret: When an enemy casts a spell on a minion, summon a 1/3 as the new target.
data.flavorText: While it's fun to intercept enemy lightning bolts, a spellbender much prefers to intercept opposing Marks of the Wild.  It just feels meaner.  And blood elves... well, they're a little mean.

data.name: Spreading Madness
data.description: Deal 9 damage randomly split among ALL characters.
data.flavorText: Most citizens of Darkshire wear those surgical masks to prevent spreading Madness to tourists.

data.name: Thoughtsteal
data.description: Copy 2 cards from your opponent's deck and put them into your hand.
data.flavorText: "What do you get when you cast Thoughtsteal on an Orc?  Nothing!" - Tauren joke

data.name: Unleash the Hounds
data.description: For each enemy minion, summon a 1/1 Hound with Charge.
data.flavorText: You must read the name of this card out loud each time you play it.

data.name: Vaporize
data.description: Secret: When a minion attacks your hero, destroy it.
data.flavorText: Rumor has it that Deathwing brought about the Cataclysm after losing a game to this card.  We may never know the truth.

data.name: Acolyte of Pain
data.description: Whenever this minion takes damage, draw a card.
data.flavorText: He trained when he was younger to be an acolyte of joy, but things didn’t work out like he thought they would.

data.name: Addled Grizzly
data.description: After you summon a minion, give it +1/+1.
data.flavorText: Druids who spend too long in bear form are more susceptible to the whispers of the Old Gods.  Right now they are whispering the lyrics to "La Bamba".

data.name: Alarm-o-Bot
data.description: At the start of your turn, swap this minion with a random one in your hand.
data.flavorText: WARNING.  WARNING.  WARNING.

data.name: Aldor Peacekeeper
data.description: Battlecry: Change an enemy minion's Attack to 1.
data.flavorText: The Aldor hate two things: the Scryers and smooth jazz.

data.name: Am'gam Rager
data.flavorText: peerc rewop

data.name: Arcane Golem
data.description: Battlecry: Give your opponent a Mana Crystal.
data.flavorText: Having Arcane golems at home really classes up the place, and as a bonus they are great conversation pieces.

data.name: Argent Horserider
data.description: ChargeDivine Shield
data.flavorText: His horse's name is Betsy.

data.name: Blackwing Technician
data.description: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, gain +1/+1.
data.flavorText: This is who you go to when your Blackwing needs a tune up. Don't go to a cut rate Blackwing tune up shop!

data.name: Blood Knight
data.description: Battlecry: All minions lose Divine Shield. Gain +3/+3 for each Shield lost.
data.flavorText: The Blood Knights get their holy powers from the Sunwell, which you should NOT bathe in.

data.name: Bloodsail Cultist
data.description: Battlecry: If you control a Pirate, give your weapon +1/+1.
data.flavorText: They're really just in it for the Blood Parrot.

data.name: Brann Bronzebeard
data.description: Your Battlecries trigger twice.
data.flavorText: Contains 75% more fiber than his brother Magni!

data.name: Carrion Grub
data.flavorText: Carrion, my wayward grub.

data.name: Coldlight Oracle
data.description: Battlecry: Each player draws 2 cards.
data.flavorText: They can see the future.   In that future both players draw more cards.   Spoooky.

data.name: Coldlight Seer
data.description: Battlecry: Give ALL other Murlocs +2 Health.
data.flavorText: The Coldlight murlocs reside in the darkest pits of the Abyssal Depths.  So no, there's no getting away from murlocs.

data.name: Coliseum Manager
data.description: Inspire: Return this minion to your hand.
data.flavorText: Meets monthly with the gladiators to discuss career goals.

data.name: Dalaran Mage
data.description: Spell Damage +1
data.flavorText: You don't see a lot of Dalaran warriors.

data.name: Darkshire Councilman
data.description: After you summon a minion, gain +1 Attack.
data.flavorText: Democracy in action!

data.name: Demolisher
data.description: At the start of your turn, deal 2 damage to a random enemy.
data.flavorText: Laying siege isn't fun for anyone.  It's not even all that effective, now that everyone has a flying mount.

data.name: Desert Camel
data.description: Battlecry: Put a 1-Cost minion from each deck into the battlefield.
data.flavorText: Dang.  This card is sweet.  Almost as sweet as Dessert Camel.

data.name: Disciple of C'Thun
data.description: Battlecry: Deal 2 damage. Give your C'Thun +2/+2 (wherever it is).
data.flavorText: C’Thun’s recruiting pitch involves cookies, which is why it’s the most popular Old God.

data.name: Dragonhawk Rider
data.description: Inspire: Gain Windfurythis turn.
data.flavorText: Check it out.  You can do barrel rolls on this thing.

data.name: Dreadscale
data.description: At the end of your turn, deal 1 damage to all other minions.
data.flavorText: Let's be clear about this:  ACIDMAW is the sidekick.

data.name: Druid of the Flame
data.description: Choose One - Transform into a 5/2 minion; or a 2/5 minion.
data.flavorText: Druids who fought too long in Northrend were easily seduced by Ragnaros; a mug of hot chocolate was generally all it took.

data.name: Earthen Ring Farseer
data.description: Battlecry: Restore 3 Health.
data.flavorText: He can see really far, and he doesn't use a telescope like those filthy pirates.

data.name: Edwin VanCleef
data.description: Combo: Gain +2/+2 for each card played earlier this turn.
data.flavorText: He led the Stonemasons in the reconstruction of Stormwind, and when the nobles refused to pay, he founded the Defias Brotherhood to, well, deconstruct Stormwind.

data.name: Emperor Cobra
data.description: Destroy any minion damaged by this minion.
data.flavorText: The Sholazar Basin is home to a lot of really horrible things. If you're going to visit, wear bug spray.  And plate armor.

data.name: Eydis Darkbane
data.description: Whenever you target this minion with a spell, deal 3 damage to a random enemy.
data.flavorText: HATES being called "the wonder twins".

data.name: Felguard
data.description: Taunt. Battlecry: Destroy one of your Mana Crystals.
data.flavorText: Yes, he'll fight for you.  BUT HE'S NOT GOING TO LIKE IT.

data.name: Fencing Coach
data.description: Battlecry: The next time you use your Hero Power, it costs (2) less.
data.flavorText: Good fencers make good neighbors, right?

data.name: Fierce Monkey
data.description: Taunt
data.flavorText: Fierce monkey.  That funky monkey.

data.name: Fjola Lightbane
data.description: Whenever you target this minion with a spell, gain Divine Shield.
data.flavorText: LOVES being called "the wonder twins".

data.name: Flamewaker
data.description: After you cast a spell, deal 2 damage randomly split among all enemies.
data.flavorText: Flamewakers HATE being confused for Flamewalkers. They just wake up fire, they don’t walk on it. Walking on fire is CRAZY.

data.name: Flesheating Ghoul
data.description: Whenever a minion dies, gain +1 Attack.
data.flavorText: 'Flesheating' is an unfair name.  It's just that there's not really much else for him to eat.

data.name: Forlorn Stalker
data.description: Battlecry: Give all Deathrattle minions in your hand +1/+1.
data.flavorText: He's going to leave the dying up to you, if that's cool.

data.name: Frothing Berserker
data.description: Whenever a minion takes damage, gain +1 Attack.
data.flavorText: He used to work as an accountant before he tried his hand at Berserkering.

data.name: Harvest Golem
data.description: Deathrattle: Summon a 2/1 Damaged Golem.
data.flavorText: "Overheat threshold exceeded. System failure. Wheat clog in port two. Shutting down."

data.name: Ice Rager
data.flavorText: He's a lot cooler than Magma Rager.

data.name: Imp Gang Boss
data.description: Whenever this minion takes damage, summon a 1/1 Imp.
data.flavorText: His imp gang likes to sneak into Stormwind to spraypaint "Ragnaros Rulez" on the Mage Tower.

data.name: Imp Master
