data.description: Battlecry: Enemy spells cost (0) next turn.
data.flavorText: "I'm gonna light you up, sweetcheeks!"

data.name: Murloc Tidehunter
data.description: Battlecry: Summon a 1/1 Murloc Scout.
data.flavorText: "Death will rise, from the tides!"

data.name: Museum Curator
data.description: Battlecry: Discover a Deathrattle card.
data.flavorText: He is forever cursing the kids who climb on the rails and the evil archeologists who animate the exhibits.

data.name: Nat Pagle
data.description: At the start of your turn, you have a 50% chance to draw an extra card.
data.flavorText: Nat Pagle, Azeroth's premier fisherman!  He invented the Auto-Angler 3000, the Extendo-Pole 3000, and the Lure-o-matic 2099 (still in testing).

data.name: Nat, the Darkfisher
data.description: At the start of your opponent's turn, they have a 50% chance to draw an extra card.
data.flavorText: You can take away his humanity, but you will never take away his fishing pole.

data.name: Novice Engineer
data.description: Battlecry: Draw a card.
data.flavorText: "Half of this class will not graduate… since they'll have been turned to chickens." - Tinkmaster Overspark, teaching Gizmos 101.

data.name: Patient Assassin
data.description: Stealth. Destroy any minion damaged by this minion.
data.flavorText: He’s not really that patient. It just takes a while for someone to walk by that he can actually reach.

data.name: Pint-Sized Summoner
data.description: The first minion you play each turn costs (1) less.
data.flavorText: She's quite jealous of the Gallon-Sized Summoner.

data.name: River Crocolisk
data.flavorText: Edward "Lefty" Smith tried to make luggage out of a river crocolisk once.

data.name: Scavenging Hyena
data.description: Whenever a friendly Beast dies, gain +2/+1.
data.flavorText: Hyenas prefer the bones of kodos or windserpents, but they'll eat pretty much anything.  Even Brussels sprouts.

data.name: Sorcerer's Apprentice
data.description: Your spells cost (1) less.
data.flavorText: Apprentices are great for bossing around.  "Conjure me some mana buns! And a coffee!  Make that a mana coffee!"

data.name: Sparring Partner
data.description: TauntBattlecry: Give aminion Taunt.
data.flavorText: Come at me, bro.

data.name: Succubus
data.description: Battlecry: Discard a random card.
data.flavorText: Warlocks have it pretty good.

data.name: Sunfury Protector
data.description: Battlecry: Give adjacent minions Taunt.
data.flavorText: She carries a shield, but only so she can give it to someone she can stand behind.

data.name: Tiny Knight of Evil
data.description: Whenever you discard a card, gain +1/+1.
data.flavorText: "No, no, no. I asked for a tiny JESTER of evil."

data.name: Totem Golem
data.description: Overload: (1).
data.flavorText: What happens when you glue a buncha totems together.

data.name: Twilight Geomancer
data.description: [x]TauntBattlecry: Give your C'ThunTaunt (wherever it is).
data.flavorText: "Ok C'Thun, repeat after me: 'Your mother was a hamster.'"

data.name: Twisted Worgen
data.description: Stealth
data.flavorText: Sometimes the Old Gods' corruptions gives you power untold, sometimes you get +1 Attack. We can’t all be winners in the Eldritch lottery.

data.name: Undercity Huckster
data.description: Deathrattle: Add a random class card to your hand (from your opponent's class).
data.flavorText: Psst! Wanna buy a random class card (from your opponent's class)?

data.name: Undercity Valiant
data.description: Combo: Deal 1 damage.
data.flavorText: Almost went to play for Stormwind before signing with Undercity.

data.name: Wild Pyromancer
data.description: After you cast a spell, deal 1 damage to ALL minions.
data.flavorText: BOOM BABY BOOM!  BAD IS GOOD!  DOWN WITH GOVERNMENT!

data.name: Wrathguard
data.description: Whenever this minion takes damage, also deal that amount to your hero.
data.flavorText: After playing against 5 Annoy-O-Trons, any normal guard will become a Wrathguard.

data.name: Wyrmrest Agent
data.description: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, gain +1 Attack and Taunt.
data.flavorText: Keeping tabs on the Grand Tournament is priority #1 for the five mighty Dragonflights!

data.name: Youthful Brewmaster
data.description: Battlecry: Return a friendly minion from the battlefield to your hand.
data.flavorText: His youthful enthusiasm doesn’t always equal excellence in his brews.   Don’t drink the Mogu Stout!

data.name: Cursed Blade
data.description: Double all damage dealt to your hero.
data.flavorText: The Curse is that you have to listen to "MMMBop" on repeat.

data.name: Light's Justice
data.flavorText: Prince Malchezaar was a collector of rare weapons. He'd animate them and have them dance for him.

data.name: Arcane Blast
data.description: Deal 2 damage to a minion. This spell gets double bonus from Spell Damage.
data.flavorText: Now with 100% more blast!

data.name: Arcane Missiles
data.description: Deal 3 damage randomly split among all enemies.
data.flavorText: You'd think you'd be able to control your missiles a little better since you're a powerful mage and all.

data.name: Arcane Shot
data.description: Deal 2 damage.
data.flavorText: Magi conjured arcane arrows to sell to hunters, until hunters learned just enough magic to do it themselves.  The resulting loss of jobs sent Stormwind into a minor recession.

data.name: Bestial Wrath
data.description: Give a friendly Beast +2 Attack and Immune this turn.
data.flavorText: The seething wrath is just beneath the surface.  Beneath that is wild abandon, followed by slight annoyance.

data.name: Blessing of Might
data.description: Give a minion +3 Attack.
data.flavorText: "As in, you MIGHT want to get out of my way." - Toad Mackle, recently buffed.

data.name: Blessing of Wisdom
data.description: Choose a minion. Whenever it attacks, draw a card.
data.flavorText: Apparently with wisdom comes the knowledge that you should probably be attacking every turn.

data.name: Blood To Ichor
data.description: Deal 1 damage to a minion. If it survives, summon a 2/2 Slime.
data.flavorText: For his next trick, he turns the ichor back to blood and stuffs it back in you.

data.name: Claw
data.description: Give your hero +2 Attack this turn and 2 Armor.
data.flavorText: The claw decides who will stay and who will go.

data.name: Cold Blood
data.description: Give a minion +2 Attack. Combo: +4 Attack instead.
data.flavorText: "I'm cold blooded, check it and see!"

data.name: Competitive Spirit
data.description: Secret: When your turn starts, give your minions +1/+1.
data.flavorText: Competition can be an inspiration to improve oneself.  Or kill all the competitors.

data.name: Conceal
data.description: Give your minions Stealth until your next turn.
data.flavorText: Rogues conceal everything but their emotions.  You can't get 'em to shut up about feelings.

data.name: Corruption
data.description: Choose an enemy minion. At the start of your turn, destroy it.
data.flavorText: It starts with stealing a pen from work, and before you know it, BOOM!  Corrupted!

data.name: Deadly Poison
data.description: Give your weapon +2 Attack.
data.flavorText: Rogues guard the secrets to poison-making carefully, lest magi start incorporating poison into their spells.  Poisonbolt? Rain of Poison?  Poison Elemental?  Nobody wants that.

data.name: Divine Strength
data.description: Give a minion +1/+2.
data.flavorText: Every year a few paladins get disqualified from the Westfall weight lifting championship for using Divine Strength.

data.name: Earth Shock
data.description: Silence a minion, then deal 1 damage to it.
data.flavorText: Earth Shock? Shouldn't it be "Azeroth Shock"?

data.name: Evolve
data.description: Transform your minions into random minions that cost (1) more.
data.flavorText: So you say you want an evolution. Well, you know. We all want to change the board.

data.name: Execute
data.description: Destroy a damaged enemy minion.
data.flavorText: It's okay, he deserved it.

data.name: Eye for an Eye
data.description: Secret: When your hero takes damage, deal that much damage to the enemy hero.
data.flavorText: Justice sometimes takes the form of a closed fist into a soft cheek.

data.name: Flash Heal
data.description: Restore #5 Health.
data.flavorText: Flash!  Ahhhhhhh~

data.name: Forked Lightning
data.description: Deal 2 damage to 2 random enemy minions. Overload: (2)
data.flavorText: If you combine it with Spooned Lightning and Knived Lightning, you have the full dining set.

data.name: Frost Shock
data.description: Deal 1 damage to an enemy character and Freeze it.
data.flavorText: FROST SHOCK!

data.name: Hand of Protection
data.description: Give a minion Divine Shield.
data.flavorText: This spell has been renamed so many times, even paladins don’t know what it should be called anymore.

data.name: Holy Smite
data.description: Deal 2 damage.
data.flavorText: It doesn't matter how pious you are.  Everyone needs a good smiting now and again.

data.name: Humility
data.description: Change a minion's Attack to 1.
data.flavorText: This card makes something really damp.  Oh wait.  That's "Humidity."

data.name: Hunter's Mark
data.description: Change a minion's Health to 1.
data.flavorText: Never play 'Hide and Go Seek' with a Hunter.

data.name: Ice Lance
data.description: Freeze a character. If it was already Frozen, deal 4 damage instead.
data.flavorText: The trick is not to break the lance.  Otherwise, you have "Ice Pieces."  Ice Pieces aren't as effective.

data.name: Inner Fire
data.description: Change a minion's Attack to be equal to its Health.
data.flavorText: Good idea: Buffing your minions.  Bad idea: Starting a conversation in the Barrens.

data.name: Journey Below
data.description: Discover a Deathrattle card.
data.flavorText: Don't stop believing there's something below.

data.name: Lightning Bolt
data.description: Deal 3 damage. Overload: (1)
data.flavorText: Lightning Bolt! Lightning Bolt! Lightning Bolt!

data.name: Living Roots
data.description: Choose One - Deal 2 damage; or Summon two 1/1 Saplings.
data.flavorText: 2 out of 2 saplings recommend that you summon the saplings.

data.name: Mind Vision
data.description: Put a copy of a random card in your opponent's hand into your hand.
data.flavorText: I see what you did there.

data.name: Mirror Image
data.description: Summon two 0/2 minions with Taunt.
data.flavorText: Oh hey it's Mirror Image! !egamI rorriM s'ti yeh hO

data.name: Mortal Coil
data.description: Deal 1 damage to a minion. If that kills it, draw a card.
data.flavorText: If your spells look like horrifying skulls, let's be honest, you should get to draw some cards.

data.name: Naturalize
data.description: Destroy a minion. Your opponent draws 2 cards.
data.flavorText: Another one bites the dust.

data.name: Noble Sacrifice
data.description: Secret: When an enemy attacks, summon a 2/1 Defender as the new target.
data.flavorText: We will always remember you, "Defender!"

data.name: On the Hunt
data.description: Deal 1 damage.Summon a 1/1 Mastiff.
data.flavorText: The mastiff giggles if you don't hit any ducks.

data.name: Power Overwhelming
data.description: Give a friendly minion +4/+4 until end of turn. Then, it dies. Horribly.
data.flavorText: We cannot even describe how horrible the death is.  It's CRAZY bad!  Maybe worse than that.  Just don't do it.

data.name: Power Word: Glory
data.description: Choose a minion. Whenever it attacks, restore 4 Health toyour hero.
data.flavorText: The promise of glory is a powerful tool to get minions to do your bidding.  Only slightly less powerful than the promise of an ice cream bar!

data.name: Power Word: Shield
data.description: Give a minion +2 Health.Draw a card.
data.flavorText: Sure the extra protection is nice, but the shield really reduces visibility.

data.name: Primal Fusion
data.description: Give a minion +1/+1 for each of your Totems.
data.flavorText: Golce and Dabbana have a new line of Earth Totems available at vendors everywhere this holiday season.

data.name: Raven Idol
data.description: Choose One -Discover a minion; or Discover a spell.
data.flavorText: Was petrified when it found out it didn't make the cut for Azerothean Idol.

data.name: Redemption
data.description: Secret: When one of your minions dies, return it to life with 1 Health.
data.flavorText: I am not sure how you get demptioned the first time.  It’s a mystery!

data.name: Repentance
data.description: Secret: After your opponent plays a minion, reduce its Health to 1.
data.flavorText: Repentance often comes in the moment before obliteration. Curious.

data.name: Rockbiter Weapon
data.description: Give a friendly character +3 Attack this turn.
data.flavorText: This would be real handy if your enemy is made of rock.

data.name: Sacred Trial
data.description: Secret: After your opponent has at least 3 minions and plays another, destroy it.
data.flavorText: You have chosen poorly.

data.name: Savagery
data.description: Deal damage equal to your hero's Attack to a minion.
data.flavorText: It is true that some druids are savage, but others still enjoy a quiet moment and a spot of tea.

data.name: Shield Slam
data.description: Deal 1 damage to a minion for each Armor you have.
data.flavorText: "What is a better weapon? The sharp one your enemies expect, or the blunt one they ignore?" - The Art of Warrior, Chapter 9

data.name: Sinister Strike
data.description: Deal 3 damage to the enemy hero.
data.flavorText: There's something about this strike that just feels off.  Sinister, even.

data.name: Soulfire
data.description: Deal 4 damage. Discard a random card.
data.flavorText: Are you lighting a soul on fire? Or burning someone with your OWN soul? This seems like an important distinction.

data.name: Tracking
data.description: Look at the top three cards of your deck. Draw one and discard the others.
data.flavorText: For the person who just cannot decide what card to put into a deck!

data.name: Upgrade!
data.description: If you have a weapon, give it +1/+1. Otherwise equip a 1/3 weapon.
data.flavorText: Easily worth 50 DKP.

data.name: Whirlwind
data.description: Deal 1 damage to ALL minions.
data.flavorText: The way to tell seasoned warriors from novice ones: the novices yell "wheeeee" while whirlwinding.

data.name: Abusive Sergeant
data.description: Battlecry: Give a minion +2 Attack this turn.
data.flavorText: ADD ME TO YOUR DECK, MAGGOT!

data.name: Angry Chicken
data.description: Enrage: +5 Attack.
data.flavorText: There is no beast more frightening (or ridiculous) than a fully enraged chicken.

data.name: Argent Squire
data.description: Divine Shield
data.flavorText: "I solemnly swear to uphold the Light, purge the world of darkness, and to eat only burritos." - The Argent Dawn Oath

data.name: Bladed Cultist
data.description: Combo: Gain +1/+1.
data.flavorText: He has a poor understanding of the law of diminishing returns.

data.name: Blood Imp
data.description: Stealth. At the end of your turn, give another random friendly minion +1 Health.
data.flavorText: Imps are content to hide and viciously taunt everyone nearby.

data.name: Bloodsail Corsair
data.description: Battlecry: Remove 1 Durability from your opponent's weapon.
data.flavorText: Every pirate uses the same four digits to access Automated Gold Dispensers.  It's called the "Pirate's Code".

data.name: Brave Archer
data.description: Inspire: If your hand is empty, deal 2 damage to the enemy hero.
data.flavorText: This is a "bearly" concealed reference.

data.name: Buccaneer
data.description: Whenever you equip a weapon, give it +1 Attack.
data.flavorText: The best part of buccaneering is the pants.

data.name: Dragon Egg
data.description: Whenever this minion takes damage, summon a 2/1 Whelp.
data.flavorText: Think of them as bullets for your dragon gun.

data.name: Dust Devil
data.description: Windfury. Overload: (2)
data.flavorText: Westfall is full of dust devils. And buzzards. And crazed golems. And pirates. Why does anyone live here?

data.name: Elven Archer
data.description: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage.
data.flavorText: Don't bother asking her out on a date.  She'll shoot you down.

data.name: Fiery Bat
data.description: Deathrattle: Deal 1 damage to a random enemy.
data.flavorText: He'll always be our first.

data.name: Flame Imp
data.description: Battlecry: Deal 3 damage to your hero.
data.flavorText: Imps like being on fire.  They just do.

data.name: Forbidden Ancient
data.description: Battlecry: Spend all your Mana. Gain +1/+1 for each mana spent.
data.flavorText: This Ancient was banned from the local tavern after tucking a 'Dr. Boom' up its sleeve.

data.name: Gadgetzan Jouster
data.description: Battlecry: Reveal a minion in each deck. If yours costs more, gain +1/+1.
data.flavorText: It's not HER fault you didn't put a spinning saw blade on your horse.

data.name: Goldshire Footman
data.description: Taunt
data.flavorText: If 1/2 minions are all that is defending Goldshire, you would think it would have been overrun years ago.

data.name: Grimscale Oracle
data.description: ALL other Murlocs have +1 Attack.
data.flavorText: These are the brainy murlocs.  It turns out that doesn’t mean much.

data.name: Hungry Crab
data.description: Battlecry: Destroy a Murloc and gain +2/+2.
data.flavorText: Murloc.  It's what's for dinner.

data.name: Injured Kvaldir
data.description: Battlecry: Deal 3 damage to this minion.
data.flavorText: Don't worry.  With a little skin cream he's going to clear right up.

data.name: Leper Gnome
data.description: Deathrattle: Deal 2 damage to the enemy hero.
data.flavorText: He really just wants to be your friend, but the constant rejection is starting to really get to him.

data.name: Lightwarden
data.description: Whenever a character is healed, gain +2 Attack.
data.flavorText: She’s smaller than her sisters Mediumwarden and Heavywarden.

data.name: Lowly Squire
data.description: Inspire: Gain +1 Attack.
data.flavorText: But not the lowliest!

data.name: Mana Wyrm
data.description: Whenever you cast a spell, gain +1 Attack.
data.flavorText: These wyrms feed on arcane energies, and while they are generally considered a nuisance rather than a real threat, you really shouldn't leave them alone with a bucket of mana.

data.name: Murloc Raider
data.flavorText: Mrrraggglhlhghghlgh, mrgaaag blarrghlgaahahl mrgggg glhalhah a bghhll graggmgmg Garrosh mglhlhlh mrghlhlhl!!

data.name: Murloc Tidecaller
data.description: Whenever a Murloc is summoned, gain +1 Attack.
data.flavorText: This guy gets crazy strong at family reunions.

data.name: Northshire Cleric
data.description: Whenever a minion is healed, draw a card.
data.flavorText: They help the downtrodden and distressed.  Also they sell cookies.

data.name: N'Zoth's First Mate
data.description: Battlecry: Equip a 1/3 Rusty Hook.
data.flavorText: Hates when N'Zoth yells "Ahoy Matey!!", but there's not really much he can do about it.

data.name: Pit Snake
data.description: Destroy any minion damaged by this minion.
data.flavorText: It could be worse.  It could be a Snake Pit.

data.name: Possessed Villager
data.description: Deathrattle: Summon a 1/1 Shadowbeast.
data.flavorText: It's like a pinata! A lame disgusting horrific pinata.

data.name: Reliquary Seeker
data.description: Battlecry: If you have 6 other minions, gain +4/+4.
data.flavorText: The Reliquary considers itself the equal of the League of Explorers.  The League of Explorers doesn't.

data.name: Secretkeeper
data.description: Whenever a Secret is played, gain +1/+1.
data.flavorText: She promises not to tell anyone about that thing you did last night with that one person.

data.name: Selfless Hero
data.description: Deathrattle: Give a random friendly minion Divine Shield.
data.flavorText: "Don't worry about me… I'll just be here... under these tentacles."

data.name: Shieldbearer
data.description: Taunt
data.flavorText: Have you seen the size of the shields in this game??  This is no easy job.

data.name: Shifter Zerus
data.description: Each turn this is in your hand, transform it into a random minion.
data.flavorText: It's like being able to play with THREE angry chickens!

data.name: Sir Finley Mrrgglton
data.description: Battlecry: Discover a new basic Hero Power.
data.flavorText: In addition to fluent Common, he also speaks fourteen dialects of 'mrgl'.

data.name: Southsea Deckhand
data.description: Has Charge while you have a weapon equipped.
data.flavorText: Pirates are into this new fad called "Planking".

data.name: Stonetusk Boar
data.description: Charge
data.flavorText: This card is boaring.

data.name: Tentacle of N'Zoth
data.description: Deathrattle: Deal 1 damage to all minions.
data.flavorText: Because EVERYDAY is the Day of the Tentacle of N'zoth.

data.name: Timber Wolf
data.description: Your other Beasts have +1 Attack.
data.flavorText: Other beasts totally dig hanging out with timber wolves.

data.name: Tournament Attendee
data.description: Taunt
data.flavorText: He was so excited to get season tickets to this year's Grand Tournament.  He normally doesn't get them at first and has to buy them from Ogre scalpers.

data.name: Tunnel Trogg
data.description: Whenever you Overload, gain +1 Attack per locked Mana Crystal.
data.flavorText: Sure, they're ugly, but they live in tunnels.  You try your beauty routine without natural light.

data.name: Twilight Whelp
data.description: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, gain +2 Health.
data.flavorText: The twilight whelps are basically magic-vampires. Despite this, they are not a reference to any popular series of novels.

data.name: Vilefin Inquisitor
data.description: Battlecry: Your Hero Power becomes 'Summon a   1/1 Murloc.'
data.flavorText: Nobody expects the Vilefin Inquisition!

data.name: Voidwalker
data.description: Taunt
data.flavorText: No relation to "The Voidsteppers", the popular Void-based dance troupe.

data.name: Voodoo Doctor
data.description: Battlecry: Restore 2 Health.
data.flavorText: Voodoo is an oft-misunderstood art. But it is art.

data.name: Worgen Infiltrator
data.description: Stealth
data.flavorText: If you want to stop a worgen from infiltrating, just yell, "No! Bad boy!"

data.name: Young Dragonhawk
data.description: Windfury
data.flavorText: They were the inspiration for the championship Taurenball team: The Dragonhawks.

data.name: Young Priestess
data.description: At the end of your turn, give another random friendly minion +1 Health.
data.flavorText: She can't wait to learn Power Word: Fortitude Rank 2.

data.name: Zealous Initiate
data.description: Deathrattle: Give a random friendly minion +1/+1.
data.flavorText: Ok, Initiate. You need to settle down and do your job. In this case, that means die so someone else can get a minor buff.

data.name: Ancestral Healing
data.description: Restore a minion to full Health and give it Taunt.
data.flavorText: I personally prefer some non-ancestral right-the-heck-now healing, but maybe that is just me.

data.name: Backstab
data.description: Deal 2 damage to an undamaged minion.
data.flavorText: It's funny how often yelling "Look over there!" gets your opponent to turn around.

data.name: Circle of Healing
data.description: Restore #4 Health to ALL minions.
data.flavorText: It isn't really a circle.

data.name: Forbidden Flame
data.description: Spend all your Mana. Deal that much damage to a minion.
data.flavorText: WARNING: This flame is not to be used unless you are a licensed acolyte of the Old Gods.

data.name: Forbidden Healing
data.description: Spend all your Mana. Restore twice that much Health.
data.flavorText: No one's quite sure why it's forbidden. And yes, that should make you nervous.

data.name: Forbidden Ritual
data.description: Spend all your Mana. Summon that many 1/1 Tentacles.
data.flavorText: Actually, C'Thun gives his full support for this ritual.

data.name: Forbidden Shaping
data.description: Spend all your Mana. Summon a random minion that costs that much.
data.flavorText: But the minion arrives covered in goo.

data.name: Inner Rage
data.description: Deal 1 damage to a minion and give it +2 Attack.
data.flavorText: They're only smiling on the outside.

data.name: Innervate
data.description: Gain 2 Mana Crystals this turn only.
data.flavorText: Some druids still have flashbacks from strangers yelling "Innervate me!!" at them.

data.name: Moonfire
data.description: Deal 1 damage.
data.flavorText: "Cast Moonfire, and never stop." - How to Be a Druid, Chapter 5, Section 3

data.name: Preparation
data.description: The next spell you cast this turn costs (3) less.
data.flavorText: "Be Prepared" - Rogue Motto

data.name: Sacrificial Pact
data.description: Destroy a Demon. Restore #5 Health to your hero.
data.flavorText: This is the reason that Demons never really become friends with Warlocks.

data.name: Shadowstep
data.description: Return a friendly minion to your hand. It costs (2) less.
data.flavorText: Rogue dance troops will sometimes Shadowstep away at the end of a performance.  Crowds love it.

data.name: Silence
data.description: Silence a minion.
data.flavorText: Reserved for enemy spellcasters, evil liches from beyond the grave, and karaoke nights at the Grim Guzzler.

data.name: Totemic Might
data.description: Give your Totems +2 Health.
data.flavorText: Totem-stomping is no longer recommended.

data.name: Murloc Tinyfin
data.flavorText: High mortality rate, from often being hugged to death.

data.name: Wisp
data.flavorText: If you hit an Eredar Lord with enough Wisps, it will explode.   But why?

data.name: Clockwork Giant
data.description: Costs (1) less for each card in your opponent's hand.
data.flavorText: He and Mountain Giant don't get along.

data.name: Tree of Life
data.description: Restore all characters to full Health.
data.flavorText: Healing: It grows on trees!

data.name: Mal'Ganis
data.description: Your other Demons have +2/+2.Your hero is Immune.
data.flavorText: Mal'Ganis doesn't like being betrayed, so if you discard him, watch out.

data.name: Mekgineer Thermaplugg
data.description: Whenever an enemy minion dies, summon a Leper Gnome.
data.flavorText: He was obsessed with explosives until he discovered knitting. Now he yells, “SWEATERS! MORE SWEATERS!”

data.name: Foe Reaper 4000
data.description: Also damages the minions next to whomever he attacks.
data.flavorText: Foe reaping is really not so different from harvest reaping, at the end of the day.

data.name: Force-Tank MAX
data.description: Divine Shield
data.flavorText: There is a factory in Tanaris for crafting force-tanks, but it only ever made two, because of cost overruns.

data.name: Kel'Thuzad
data.description: At the end of each turn, summon all friendly minions that died this turn.
data.flavorText: Kel'Thuzad could not resist the call of the Lich King. Even when it's just a robo-call extolling the Lich King's virtues.

data.name: Sneed's Old Shredder
data.description: Deathrattle: Summon a random Legendary minion.
data.flavorText: When Sneed was defeated in the Deadmines, his shredder was sold at auction to an anonymous buyer. (Probably Hogger.)

data.name: Crush
data.description: Destroy a minion. If you have a damaged minion, this costs (4) less.
data.flavorText: Using this card on your enemies is one of the best things in life, according to some barbarians.

data.name: Dr. Boom
data.description: Battlecry: Summon two 1/1 Boom Bots. WARNING: Bots may explode.
data.flavorText: MARVEL AT HIS MIGHT!

data.name: Flame Leviathan
data.description: When you draw this, deal 2 damage to all characters.
data.flavorText: Mimiron likes to take the Flame Leviathan out on some sweet joyrides.

data.name: Gahz'rilla
data.description: Whenever this minion takes damage, double its Attack.
data.flavorText: The Sen'jin High football team is The Gahz'rillas.

data.name: Malorne
data.description: Deathrattle: Shuffle this minion into your deck.
data.flavorText: When Malorne isn't mauling hordes of demons, he enjoys attending parties, though he prefers to go stag.

data.name: Neptulon
data.description: Battlecry: Add 4 random Murlocs to your hand. Overload: (3)
data.flavorText: Neptulon is "The Tidehunter". He’s one of the four elemental lords. And he and Ragnaros get together and make really amazing saunas.

data.name: Troggzor the Earthinator
data.description: Whenever your opponent casts a spell, summon a Burly Rockjaw Trogg.
data.flavorText: He keeps earthinating the countryside despite attempts to stop him.

data.name: Dark Wispers
data.description: Choose One - Summon 5 Wisps; or Give a minion +5/+5 and Taunt.
data.flavorText: Don't worry; we fired the person who named this card.

data.name: Lightbomb
data.description: Deal damage to each minion equal to its Attack.
data.flavorText: This is what happens when you allow goblins to be priests.

data.name: Recycle
data.description: Shuffle an enemy minion into your opponent's deck.
data.flavorText: Druidic recycling involves putting plastics in one bin and enemy minions in another bin.

data.name: Anima Golem
data.description: At the end of each turn, destroy this minion if it's your only one.
data.flavorText: The Dark Animus is evil and mysterious and huge and unable to write sentences that utilize proper grammar.

data.name: Gazlowe
data.description: Whenever you cast a 1-mana spell, add a random Mech to your hand.
data.flavorText: Gazlowe was voted "Most Likely to Explode" in high school.

data.name: Gelbin Mekkatorque
data.description: Battlecry: Summon an AWESOME invention.
data.flavorText: He's the leader of the gnomes, and an incredible inventor.  He's getting better, too; He turns things into chickens WAY less than he used to.

data.name: Iron Juggernaut
data.description: Battlecry: Shuffle a Mine into your opponent's deck. When drawn, it explodes for 10 damage.
data.flavorText: The Iron Juggernaut guards Orgrimmar and has just earned the "Employee of the Month" award!

data.name: Maexxna
data.description: Destroy any minion damaged by this minion.
data.flavorText: Maexxna gets super mad when people introduce her as "Maxina" or "Maxxy".

data.name: Mech-Bear-Cat
data.description: Whenever this minion takes damage, add a Spare Part card to your hand.
data.flavorText: Crushes buildings with his BEAR hands.

data.name: Mogor the Ogre
data.description: All minions have a 50% chance to attack the wrong enemy.
data.flavorText: Mogor helped reopen the Dark Portal once. You know you're in trouble when you have to rely on an ogre.

data.name: Piloted Sky Golem
data.description: Deathrattle: Summon a random 4-Cost minion.
data.flavorText: The pinnacle of goblin engineering. Includes an espresso machine and foot massager.

data.name: Shieldmaiden
data.description: Battlecry: Gain 5 Armor.
data.flavorText: She has three shieldbearers in her party to supply her with back ups when she gets low on durability.

data.name: Toshley
data.description: Battlecry and Deathrattle: Add a Spare Part card to your hand.
data.flavorText: Something about power converters.

data.name: Trade Prince Gallywix
data.description: Whenever your opponent casts a spell, gain a copy of it and give them a Coin.
data.flavorText: Gallywix believes in supply and demand. He supplies the beatings and demands you pay up!

data.name: Cobra Shot
data.description: Deal 3 damage to a minion and the enemy hero.
data.flavorText: "Cobra Shot" hurts way, way, way more than "Cobra Cuddle."

data.name: Demonheart
data.description: Deal 5 damage to a minion.  If it's a friendly Demon, give it +5/+5 instead.
data.flavorText: Virtually every member of the pro demon lobby is a warlock. Weird.

data.name: Antique Healbot
data.description: Battlecry: Restore 8 Health to your hero.
data.flavorText: They don't make 'em like they used to! (Because of explosions, mostly.)

data.name: Blingtron 3000
data.description: Battlecry: Equip a random weapon for each player.
data.flavorText: PREPARE PARTY SERVOS FOR IMMEDIATE DEPLOYMENT.

data.name: Bolvar Fordragon
data.description: Whenever a friendly minion dies while this is in your hand, gain +1 Attack.
data.flavorText: Spoiler alert: Bolvar gets melted and then sits on an ice throne and everyone forgets about him.

data.name: Bomb Lobber
data.description: Battlecry: Deal 4 damage to a random enemy minion.
data.flavorText: He lobbies Orgrimmar daily on behalf of bombs.

data.name: Cobalt Guardian
data.description: Whenever you summon a Mech, gain Divine Shield.
data.flavorText: Guardians used to be built out of Adamantium, but production got moved to Gadgetzan and Cobalt was cheap.

data.name: Druid of the Fang
data.description: Battlecry: If you have a Beast, transform this minion into a 7/7.
data.flavorText: The Druids of the Fang live in the Wailing Caverns. They wear cool snake shirts and tell snake jokes and say "bro" a lot.

data.name: Elite Tauren Chieftain
data.description: Battlecry: Give both players the power to ROCK! (with a Power Chord card)
data.flavorText: He's looking for a drummer.  The current candidates are: Novice Engineer, Sen'jin Shieldmasta', and Ragnaros the Firelord.

data.name: Fel Reaver
data.description: Whenever your opponent plays a card, remove the top 3 cards of your deck.
data.flavorText: So reaver. Much fel. Wow.

data.name: Feugen
data.description: Deathrattle: If Stalagg also died this game, summon Thaddius.
data.flavorText: Feugen is sad because everyone likes Stalagg better.

data.name: Floating Watcher
data.description: Whenever your hero takes damage on your turn, gain +2/+2.
data.flavorText: "Evil Eye Watcher of Doom" was the original name, but marketing felt it was a bit too aggressive.

data.name: Hemet Nesingwary
data.description: Battlecry: Destroy a Beast.
data.flavorText: It's hard to make a living as a hunter in a world where beasts instantly reappear minutes after you kill them.

data.name: Junkbot
data.description: Whenever a friendly Mech dies, gain +2/+2.
data.flavorText: One bot's junk is another bot's AWESOME UPGRADE!

data.name: King of Beasts
data.description: Taunt. Battlecry: Gain +1 Attack for each other Beast you have.
data.flavorText: He never sleeps.  Not even in the mighty jungle.

data.name: Loatheb
data.description: Battlecry: Enemy spells cost (5) more next turn.
data.flavorText: Loatheb used to be a simple Bog Beast.  This is why we need stricter regulations on mining and agriculture.

data.name: Madder Bomber
data.description: Battlecry: Deal 6 damage randomly split between all other characters.
data.flavorText: Dang, Bomber, calm down.

data.name: Mimiron's Head
data.description: At the start of your turn, if you have at least 3 Mechs, destroy them all and form V-07-TR-0N.
data.flavorText: Do not push the big red button!

data.name: Ogre Ninja
data.description: Stealth50% chance to attack the wrong enemy.
data.flavorText: He didn't have the grades to get into ninja school, but his dad pulled some strings.

data.name: Quartermaster
data.description: Battlecry: Give your Silver Hand Recruits +2/+2.
data.flavorText: His specialty? Dividing things into four pieces.

data.name: Salty Dog
data.flavorText: He's recently recovered from being a "scurvy dog."

data.name: Siege Engine
data.description: Whenever you gain Armor, give this minion +1 Attack.
data.flavorText: Wintergrasp Keep's only weakness!

data.name: Sludge Belcher
data.description: TauntDeathrattle: Summon a 1/2 Slime with Taunt.
data.flavorText: DO NOT GIVE HIM A ROOT BEER.

data.name: Spectral Knight
data.description: Can't be targeted by spells or Hero Powers.
data.flavorText: What do Faerie Dragons and Spectral Knights have in common?  They both love pasta!

data.name: Stalagg
data.description: Deathrattle: If Feugen also died this game, summon Thaddius.
data.flavorText: Stalagg want to write own flavor text.  "STALAGG AWESOME!"

data.name: Upgraded Repair Bot
data.description: Battlecry: Give a friendly Mech +4 Health.
data.flavorText: It's the same as the previous generation but they slapped the word "upgraded" on it to sell it for double.

data.name: Vol'jin
data.description: Battlecry: Swap Health with another minion.
data.flavorText: Vol'jin is a shadow hunter, which is like a shadow priest except more voodoo.

data.name: Death's Bite
data.description: Deathrattle: Deal 1 damage to all minions.
data.flavorText: "Take a bite outta Death." - McScruff the Deathlord

data.name: Ancestor's Call
data.description: Put a random minion from each player's hand into the battlefield.
data.flavorText: "Hey! Ancestors!" - Ancestor's call

data.name: Echo of Medivh
data.description: Put a copy of each friendly minion into your hand.
data.flavorText: Medivh's echo haunts Karazhan, eternally cheating at chess and Hearthstone.

data.name: Imp-losion
data.description: Deal 2-4 damage to a minion. Summon a 1/1 Imp for each damage dealt.
data.flavorText: The shrapnel is waaaaay worse than the explosion.

data.name: Poison Seeds
data.description: Destroy all minions and summon 2/2 Treants to replace them.
data.flavorText: "Poisonseed Bagel" is the least popular bagel at McTiggin's Druidic Bagel Emporium.

data.name: Sabotage
data.description: Destroy a random enemy minion. Combo: And your opponent's weapon.
data.flavorText: Rogues can't stand it. They know you planned it! They are going to set you straight!

data.name: Tinker's Sharpsword Oil
data.description: Give your weapon +3 Attack. Combo: Give a random friendly minion +3 Attack.
data.flavorText: "Get ready to strike oil!" - Super-cheesy battle cry

data.name: Anub'ar Ambusher
data.description: Deathrattle: Return a random friendly minion to your hand.
data.flavorText: Originally he was called "Anub'ar Guy who bounces a guy back to your hand", but it lacked a certain zing.

data.name: Arcane Nullifier X-21
data.description: TauntCan't be targeted by spells or Hero Powers.
data.flavorText: There was some hard talk between gnome magi and engineers about inventing this mech.

data.name: Baron Rivendare
data.description: Your minions trigger their Deathrattles twice.
data.flavorText: There used to be five Horsemen but one of them left because a job opened up in the deadmines and the benefits were better.

data.name: Burly Rockjaw Trogg
data.description: Whenever your opponent casts a spell, gain +2 Attack.
data.flavorText: He's burly because he does CrossFit.

data.name: Dunemaul Shaman
data.description: Windfury, Overload: (1)50% chance to attack the wrong enemy.
data.flavorText: He just closes his eyes and goes for it. Raarararrrarar!

data.name: Enhance-o Mechano
data.description: Battlecry: Give your other minions Windfury, Taunt, or Divine Shield.(at random)
data.flavorText: His enhancements are gluten free!

data.name: Fel Cannon
data.description: At the end of your turn, deal 2 damage to a non-Mech minion.
data.flavorText: The box says, "New and improved, with 200% more fel!"

data.name: Goblin Blastmage
data.description: Battlecry: If you have a Mech, deal 4 damage randomly split among all enemies.
data.flavorText: If you can't find a bomb to throw, just pick up any goblin invention and throw that.

data.name: Jeeves
data.description: At the end of each player's turn, that player draws until they have 3 cards.
data.flavorText: This robot is a lean, mean, butlerin' machine.

data.name: Kezan Mystic
data.description: Battlecry: Take control of a random enemy Secret.
data.flavorText: They pretend to be wise and enlightened, but they mostly just hate to be left out of a secret.

data.name: Lost Tallstrider
data.flavorText: The message, "If found, please return to Mulgore," is tattooed on his rear.

data.name: Mechanical Yeti
data.description: Deathrattle: Give each player a Spare Part.
data.flavorText: The yetis of Chillwind Point are a source of both inspiration and savage beatings.

data.name: Mini-Mage
data.description: StealthSpell Damage +1
data.flavorText: He is sometimes found hiding in the treasure chest in the Gurubashi Arena.

data.name: Old Murk-Eye
data.description: Charge. Has +1 Attack for each other Murloc on the battlefield.
data.flavorText: He's a legend among murlocs.  "Mrghllghghllghg!", they say.

data.name: Piloted Shredder
data.description: Deathrattle: Summon a random 2-Cost minion.
data.flavorText: Once upon a time, only goblins piloted shredders. These days, everyone from Doomsayer to Lorewalker Cho seems to ride one.

data.name: Screwjank Clunker
data.description: Battlecry: Give a friendly Mech +2/+2.
data.flavorText: If it breaks, just kick it a couple of times while yelling "Durn thing!"

data.name: Siltfin Spiritwalker
data.description: Whenever another friendly Murloc dies, draw a card. Overload: (1)
data.flavorText: The elements respond to anyone who calls them for a worthy cause, even if you call them by yelling, "MRGHRGLGLGL!"

data.name: Voidcaller
data.description: Deathrattle: Put a random Demon from your hand into the battlefield.
data.flavorText: "Void!  Here, void!  Here, buddy!"

data.name: Wailing Soul
data.description: Battlecry: Silence your other minions.
data.flavorText: This soul just wails on you. Dang, soul, let up already.

data.name: Wee Spellstopper
data.description: Adjacent minions can't be targeted by spells or Hero Powers.
data.flavorText: Bane of spellcasters and spelling bees everywhere.

data.name: Coghammer
data.description: Battlecry: Give a random friendly minion Divine Shield and Taunt.
data.flavorText: So you ripped this out of a machine, carved some runes on it, stuck it on a handle, and now it's a weapon of great divine power? Seems legit.

data.name: Cogmaster's Wrench
data.description: Has +2 Attack while you have a Mech.
data.flavorText: For tightening cogs and smashin' troggs!

data.name: Ogre Warmaul
data.description: 50% chance to attack the wrong enemy.
data.flavorText: Simple, misguided, and incredibly dangerous. You know, like most things ogre.

data.name: Powermace
data.description: Deathrattle: Give a random friendly Mech +2/+2.
data.flavorText: People assume that shamans control the elements, but really, they have to ask them stuff and the elements are like, "Yeah ok, sure."

data.name: Bouncing Blade
data.description: Deal 1 damage to a random minion. Repeat until a minion dies.
data.flavorText: Only goblins would think this was a good idea. Even they are starting to have their doubts.

data.name: Duplicate
data.description: Secret: When a friendly minion dies, put 2 copies of it into your hand.
data.flavorText: The one time when duping cards won't get your account banned!

data.name: Muster for Battle
data.description: Summon three 1/1 Silver Hand Recruits. Equip a 1/4 Weapon.
data.flavorText: "I'm bringing the guacamole!" – One of the most successful (yet rare) Silver Hand rallying cries

data.name: Velen's Chosen
data.description: Give a minion +2/+4 and Spell Damage +1.
data.flavorText: Velen wrote a "Lovely Card" for Tyrande with a picture of the Deeprun Tram that said "I Choo-Choo-Choose you!"

data.name: Dancing Swords
data.description: Deathrattle: Your opponent draws a card.
data.flavorText: They like to dance to reggae.

data.name: Dark Cultist
data.description: Deathrattle: Give a random friendly minion +3 Health.
data.flavorText: The Cult of the Damned has found it's best not to mention their name when recruiting new cultists.

data.name: Deathlord
data.description: Taunt. Deathrattle: Your opponent puts a minion from their deck into the battlefield.
data.flavorText: "Rise from your grave!" - Kel'Thuzad

data.name: Flying Machine
data.description: Windfury
data.flavorText: To operate, this contraption needs a hula doll on the dashboard. Otherwise it's just a “falling machine.”

data.name: Gnomeregan Infantry
data.description: ChargeTaunt
data.flavorText: The gnomes are valiant and ready to return to their irradiated, poorly ventilated homeland!

data.name: Gnomish Experimenter
data.description: Battlecry: Draw a card. If it's a minion, transform it into a Chicken.
data.flavorText: He's legitimately surprised every time he turns himself into a chicken.

data.name: Goblin Sapper
data.description: Has +4 Attack while your opponent has 6 or more cards in hand.
data.flavorText: He’s not such a binge exploder anymore. These days, he only explodes socially.

data.name: Grove Tender
data.description: Choose One - Give each player a Mana Crystal; or Each player draws a card.
data.flavorText: Likes: Hiking and the great outdoors. Dislikes: Goblin shredders and sandals. (Can’t find any that fit!).

data.name: Hobgoblin
data.description: Whenever you play a 1-Attack minion, give it +2/+2.
data.flavorText: Hobgoblins are meeting next week to discuss union benefits.  First on the list: dental plan.

data.name: Illuminator
data.description: If you control a Secret at the end of your turn, restore 4 Health to your hero.
data.flavorText: "LUMOS!" is not what they yell. What do you think this is, Hogwarts?

data.name: Iron Sensei
data.description: At the end of your turn, give another friendly Mech +2/+2.
data.flavorText:
Mechs like learning from him because he really speaks their language.

0110100001101001

data.name: Lil' Exorcist
data.description: TauntBattlecry: Gain +1/+1 for each enemy Deathrattle minion.
data.flavorText: Warlocks have the town exorcist on speed dial in case they unleash the wrong demon.

data.name: Metaltooth Leaper
data.description: Battlecry: Give your other Mechs +2 Attack.
data.flavorText: Don't leave them out in the rain. In Un'Goro Crater there is a whole colony of rust-tooth leapers.

data.name: Ogre Brute
data.description: 50% chance to attack the wrong enemy.
data.flavorText: Ogres have really terrible short-term chocolate.

data.name: Scarlet Purifier
data.description: Battlecry: Deal 2 damage to all minions with Deathrattle.
data.flavorText: The Scarlet Crusade is doing market research to find out if the "Mauve Crusade" would be better received.

data.name: Shade of Naxxramas
data.description: Stealth. At the start of your turn, gain +1/+1.
data.flavorText: The Shades of Naxxramas hate the living. They even have a slur they use to refer them: Livers.

data.name: Soot Spewer
data.description: Spell Damage +1
data.flavorText: The inventor of the goblin shredder is involved in several patent disputes with the inventor of the soot spewer.

data.name: Spider Tank
data.flavorText: "What if we put guns on it?" -Fizzblitz, staring at the spider-transportation-machine

data.name: Stoneskin Gargoyle
data.description: At the start of your turn, restore this minion to full Health.
data.flavorText: Stoneskin Gargoyles love freeze tag.

data.name: Tinkertown Technician
data.description: Battlecry: If you have a Mech, gain +1/+1 and add a Spare Part to your hand.
data.flavorText: Won't you take me to... Tinkertown?

data.name: Glaivezooka
data.description: Battlecry: Give a random friendly minion +1 Attack.
data.flavorText: For the times when a regular bazooka just isn't enough.

data.name: Call Pet
data.description: Draw a card.If it's a Beast, it costs (4) less.
data.flavorText: Real hunters tame hungry crabs.

data.name: Crackle
data.description: Deal 3-6 damage. Overload: (1)
data.flavorText: Snap! This card! Pop!

data.name: Darkbomb
data.description: Deal 3 damage.
data.flavorText: If you're looking to make an "Emo" deck, this card is perfect!

data.name: Feign Death
data.description: Trigger all Deathrattles on your minions.
data.flavorText: The hardest part about doing a "Feign Death" convincingly is learning how to make the right smell. It takes a lot of commitment.

data.name: Flamecannon
data.description: Deal 4 damage to a random enemy minion.
data.flavorText: Calling something a flamecannon really doesn't do much to distinguish it from other goblin devices.

data.name: Reincarnate
data.description: Destroy a minion, then return it to life with full Health.
data.flavorText: It's like birth, except you're an adult and you were just dead a second ago.

data.name: Seal of Light
data.description: Restore #4 Health to your hero and gain +2 Attack this turn.
data.flavorText: The walrus of Light restores EIGHT Health.

data.name: Unstable Portal
data.description: Add a random minion to your hand. It costs (3) less.
data.flavorText: The denizens of Azeroth have no idea how much work goes into stabilizing portals.  We spend like 30% of GDP on portal upkeep.

data.name: Annoy-o-Tron
data.description: TauntDivine Shield
data.flavorText: The inventor of the Annoy-o-Tron was immediately expelled from Tinkerschool, Tinkertown, and was eventually exiled from the Eastern Kingdoms altogether.

data.name: Anodized Robo Cub
data.description: Taunt. Choose One -+1 Attack; or +1 Health.
data.flavorText: It's adorable! AND OH MY GOODNESS WHY IS IT EATING MY FACE

data.name: Captain's Parrot
data.description: Battlecry: Put a random Pirate from your deck into your hand.
data.flavorText: Pirates and Parrots go together like Virmen and Carrots.

data.name: Echoing Ooze
data.description: Battlecry: Summon an exact copy of this minion at the end of the turn.
data.flavorText: OOZE... Ooze... Ooze... (ooze...)

data.name: Explosive Sheep
data.description: Deathrattle: Deal 2 damage to all minions.
data.flavorText: How is this supposed to work? Your enemies think, "Hey! Cute sheep!" and run over to cuddle it?

data.name: Gilblin Stalker
data.description: Stealth
data.flavorText:
"Shhh, I think I hear something."

"Ah, it's probably nothing." - Every Henchman

data.name: Goblin Auto-Barber
data.description: Battlecry: Give your weapon +1 Attack.
data.flavorText: This guy is excellent at adjusting your haircut and/or height.

data.name: Haunted Creeper
data.description: Deathrattle: Summon two 1/1 Spectral Spiders.
data.flavorText: Arachnofauxbia: Fear of fake spiders.

data.name: Mad Scientist
data.description: Deathrattle: Put a Secret from your deck into the battlefield.
data.flavorText: His mother wanted him to be a mage or a warlock, but noooooooo, he had to go and be a scientist like his father.

data.name: Mechwarper
data.description: Your Mechs cost (1) less.
data.flavorText: Mechs that summon mechs? What's next? Donuts that summon donuts? Mmmmm.

data.name: Micro Machine
data.description: At the start of each turn, gain +1 Attack.
data.flavorText: This card is the real thing.

data.name: Mistress of Pain
data.description: Whenever this minion deals damage, restore that much Health to your hero.
data.flavorText: Her sister is the Mistress of Pane who sells windows and shower doors.

data.name: Nerub'ar Weblord
data.description: Minions with Battlecry cost (2) more.
data.flavorText: Weblords spend all day making giant trampoline parks.

data.name: Nerubian Egg
data.description: Deathrattle: Summon a 4/4 Nerubian.
data.flavorText: Eggs are a good source of protein and Nerubians.

data.name: One-eyed Cheat
data.description: Whenever you summon a Pirate, gain Stealth.
data.flavorText: When pirates say there is no "Eye" in "team," they are very literal about it.

data.name: Puddlestomper
data.flavorText: He pays homage to Morgl, the great murloc oracle! (Who doesn't??)

data.name: Recombobulator
data.description: Battlecry: Transform a friendly minion into a random minion with the same Cost.
data.flavorText: For when you didn’t combobulate quite right the first time around.

data.name: Shadowboxer
data.description: Whenever a character is healed, deal 1 damage to a random enemy.
data.flavorText: Punching is its primary function. Also, its secondary function.

data.name: Shielded Minibot
data.description: Divine Shield
data.flavorText: He chooses to believe what he is programmed to believe!

data.name: Ship's Cannon
data.description: After you summon a Pirate, deal 2 damage to a random enemy.
data.flavorText: If you hear someone yell, "Cannonball!" you're about to get wet. Or crushed.

data.name: Shrinkmeister
data.description: Battlecry: Give a minion -2 Attack this turn.
data.flavorText: After the debacle of the Gnomish World Enlarger, gnomes are wary of size-changing inventions.

data.name: Snowchugger
data.description: Freeze any character damaged by this minion.
data.flavorText: Do the slow chant when he waddles by: "Chug! Chug! Chug!"

data.name: Steamwheedle Sniper
data.description: Your Hero Power can target minions.
data.flavorText: Goblins seldom have the patience for sniping. Most prefer lobbing explosives.

data.name: Stonesplinter Trogg
data.description: Whenever your opponent casts a spell, gain +1 Attack.
data.flavorText: The only thing worse than smelling troggs is listening to their poetry.

data.name: Unstable Ghoul
data.description: Taunt. Deathrattle: Deal 1 damage to all minions.
data.flavorText: Filling your Ghouls with Rocket Fuel is all the rage at Necromancer school.

data.name: Vitality Totem
data.description: At the end of your turn, restore 4 Health to your hero.
data.flavorText: You can usually find these at the totemist's market on Saturdays.

data.name: Whirling Zap-o-matic
data.description: Windfury
data.flavorText: If you pay a little extra, you can get it in "candy-apple red."

data.name: Avenge
data.description: Secret: When one of your minions dies, give a random friendly minion +3/+2.
data.flavorText: Several paladins have joined together to deliver justice under the name "Justice Force".  Their lawyer talked them out of calling themselves the Justice League.

data.name: Light of the Naaru
data.description: Restore #3 Health. If the target is still damaged, summon a Lightwarden.
data.flavorText: "Light it up!" - Command given to both Lightwardens and Goblins holding Flamecannons.

data.name: Clockwork Gnome
data.description: Deathrattle: Add a Spare Part card to your hand.
data.flavorText: Clockwork gnomes are always asking what time it is.

data.name: Cogmaster
data.description: Has +2 Attack while you have a Mech.
data.flavorText: After a while, you don't see the cogs and sprockets. All you see is a robot, a spider tank, a deathray...

data.name: Shadowbomber
data.description: Battlecry: Deal 3 damage to each hero.
data.flavorText: Shadowbomber does her job, but she's kind of phoning it in at this point.

data.name: Undertaker
data.description: Whenever you summon a minion with Deathrattle, gain +1 Attack.
data.flavorText: In a world where you can run to a spirit healer and resurrect yourself, Undertakers do pretty light business.

data.name: Warbot
data.description: Enrage: +1 Attack.
data.flavorText: Mass production of warbots was halted when it was discovered that they were accidentally being produced at "sample size."

data.name: Webspinner
data.description: Deathrattle: Add a random Beast card to your hand.
data.flavorText: Spider cocoons are like little piñatas!

data.name: Zombie Chow
data.description: Deathrattle: Restore 5 Health to the enemy hero.
data.flavorText: Zombie.  It's what's for dinner.

data.name: Target Dummy
data.description: Taunt
data.flavorText: The engineering equivalent of a "Kick Me" sticker.
